Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: 144man
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Chicago several times a year. We always stay at a Marriott near Michigan Ave. This is by far our new favorite. We have stayed there twice. The rooms are great, with kitchenettes so we can bring in food if we want. They serve breakfast every morning, included in the room price. The woman running the breakfast is so sweet. She greets everyone and treats them like family. I saw her helping a child fix his waffle. She gave us a huge welcome back even though she only saw us once months before. The location is great for us, about 5 short blocks from the red line. Last visit there was a snow storm on our last night there so we checked out the evening social time. We were able to have a simple meal without having to brave the storm. We will return next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mphopkins99
Reviews.Content: Was just here for an long weekend with my family. The location here is great, Magnificant Mile is within walking distance as is Willis Tower and many other Chicago landmarks. Close to the red line for longer trips or if you're less inclined to walk. A ton of places to eat and drink are very nearby. The hotel itself is well-kept, with a spacious lobby and breakfast/reception area. Our room was in great condition, and came with a full kitchen including a dishwasher. It was St Patricks Day weekend, and I expected the hotel to be noisy, but it was exceptionally quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The Marriott chain should be proud to have an employee like Ismeta, who ran the breakfast area. Her attitude and effort went far beyond what could reasonably be expected. I will definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location one block from downtown”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: Rooms a small but more than enough room. Construction next door is loud ask to be away from that if possible. They only work during the day so not an issue while sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: suero247
Reviews.Content: Me and my cousin stayed here when we came from NY for a school open house and our stay couldnt be anymore perfect. There were rooms available right away and with a great view. The front desk staff were very curtious and helpful which made my stay more comfortable. The bed was so comfortable that we used "we dont need breakfast" as an excuse to not get up but we couldnt miss breakfast as it was also perfect. There was everything you needed. The dining lady was the best. She was so nice and warm hearted and she makes the best waffle ever. Dinner isn't served but the room comes with a fridge and a stove which we took advantage of and cooked a full on meal and enjoyed every minute of it. Location was fantastic. Everything was so close. Pool is refreshing and the whirl pool lets you relax and releave some stress. This is a great hotel and i recommend it to everyone. I would definitly consider staying at this hotel again. 5 stars for just the perfect experience for the perfect trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, recommend for all...”
Reviews.Author: Jeffwhatever
Reviews.Content: I originally booked my stay with Springhill Suites next door (the two hotels are connected and share the same owner), but as they were oversold they upgraded me to a corner suite at the Residence Inn. I originally booked my king room for $99 plus tax (AAA rate), that was for a Saturday night in early March. Overall, I would highly recommend Residence Inn or Springhill Suites next door. This is my go-to hotel stay in the city of Chicago. ROOMS: Very, very nice. The door opens to a long corridor that has a kitchenette with a full sized microwave and fridge, along with two small stove burners. There is a desk/dining table that sits two chairs. This leads into a sitting area with a couch, chair and coffee table/foot-rest directly across from the king bed. Flat screen TV was along one wall. There were plenty of electrical outlets to plug into. Since this was a corner suite, two entire walls had floor to ceiling windows. The rooms are large and clean, and I couldnâ€™t have asked for anything nicer. One note is that the clubs on Hubbard do keep a late-night loud crowd on the street. If you think that might bother you, request an upper floor room. BATHROOMS: Separated by a door into one section for the vanity use, and one for the toilet/shower use. It is a large area to move around. The showers are walk-in and very nice. There is no tub. HOTEL FEATURES: I did not see a restaurant on site, but they do offer a free continental breakfast in the morning. It can get fairly crowded down there, so I did not partake. Note that there is a bagel shop connected to the hotel. I also understand that there is a pool on an upper floor. LOCATION: This is a prime location. Itâ€™s at the corner of Hubbard and Dearborn. Hubbard is a great spot for River North restaurants and nightlife. There are so many restaurants and clubs within a SHORT walk I couldnâ€™t even begin to list them, but rest assured you will not be disappointed. Michigan Ave shopping is a brisk walk or short cab ride away. This is a safe and lively area and one of the best places to stay in the city. WHO I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL FOR: Just about every type of traveler. Iâ€™m a solo pleasure traveler, and the Springhill/Residence Inn is my go-to stay in the city. I see a lot of families and business travelers as well. I donâ€™t think anyone can go wrong here. HOTEL TIP: AAA members get a good discount at this hotel and Springhill Suites. Also note that this hotel offers free wifi. If you have a portable DVD player, the TV has composite connection on the back. Marriott rewards member are more likely to get upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Indianapolisresident
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Residence Inn Chicago Downtown/ River North in early March 2012. Our room was the 1 bedroom king bed suite (room number 2005). The room was very clean, nicely decorated, and very quiet. The room had everything we needed for a three night stay. The kitchen had a full size frig with icemaker, microwave, utensils, plates, wine glasses, coffee cups, etc. along with a full size coffee pot. (I didn't see a wine opener, but we brought our own).The prepacked coffee that comes with the room is good, but don't forget to bring your favorite sweetener and creamer if you're picky about that since the generic stuff just doesn't start the day right. The bedroom had plenty of drawer space and nice hangers and the king bed was really comfortable. The sink and vanity being separated from the shower/toilet by a door helps speed up morning and bedtime routines. The shower/ toilet area was very roomy, and the vanity had excellent lighting for applying makeup. The only thing I missed was a ledge or something in the shower to help me shave my legs since it is only a shower, and not a tub/shower combo. Harry Caray's steakhouse is just across the street, three blocks north on Clark is the Rainforest Cafe and Hard Rock. There is a CVS drugstore one block west on Kinzie street that sells beer, wine, and liquor besided the usual stuff you forget when on vacation. The pool and hot tub were really clean, and the hot tub was really hot, not just lukewarm. (Great for sore feet after a long day shopping or museum hopping). The exercise room was tremendous! Treadmills with TV's, ellipticals, free weights, and a combination type fitness machine for rowing and pulldown type exercises. The included breakfast had scrambled eggs, ham or sausage patties depending on the day, breakfast potatoes, fruit, yogurt, make your own waffle, muffins, plenty of juices, milk, and coffee. The dining area was quite large and lots of windows to enjoy the city view. The breakfast hostess was friendly and efficient. The entire hotel staff was friendly too. The check-in process was smooth, but we were a little confused about what to do with our car. If you don't want to valet park, go ahead and park in the Greenway parking garage that's attached to the hotel. The garage entrance is on Kinzie street west of the Dearborn intersection. After parking, take your parking ticket with you to the hotel desk. They will convert it into the plastic swipe card that you pay $40 per day for unlimited in/out use during your stay. We didn't know about the parking garage procedure so we pulled up in front of the hotel and had to give our keys to the attendent while we checked in even though we were not going to valet park. This was some kind of hotel policy and bothered us a little. There's also no luggage carts available if you park in the garage so you might have to make more than one trip to the car. Overall though, once everything was in the room, the parking garage was very convenient instead of relying on valet parking. I was very happy with our stay, and think the location and amenities are excellent value for the money. We used AAA discount, online booking through the official hotel site and for the king suite, and the $40 per day parking along with assorted taxes paid $197 per night. Since breakfast and evening "social hour" were included, I think we got a fair value without having to resort to the discount bidding type of reservation. I would definitely stay here again when visiting downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: getmethereMichigan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Residence Inn Chicago River North for 2 nights in Feb. while I had a business meeting. Self parking (at first confusing) turned out to be easy but costly-$40/night for in and out service. Check in was fast, and everyone from the door men and front desk to breakfast attendants were very friendly. We stayed in the King corner suite which was very big and clean. I love having a full size fridg with ice maker, plates, all kinds of glassware and utensils at our disposal. Except for the included breakfast we ate our dinners out and reheated leftovers for lunch. There is a full size coffee maker - if you're staying an extended time and love your coffee bring your favorite brand with filters. No tub but the shower is huge and spotless. Harry Caray's steakhouse is across the street and the House of Blues is just down the block. If you are looking at hotel/suites in downtown Chicago the Springhill Suites is actually in the same building (FYI). The pool looked nice but was loaded with kids on Sat night so didn't go in.. I booked this hotel 6 weeks in advance of our trip and kept checking prices. I ended up saving $100 when I checked online the night before leaving home and the price had dropped so I called the toll free number and they happily gave me the lower price. Great place to stay in Chicago I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Value for Money in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: FrankSpedding
Reviews.Content: I have been coming from the Uk to Chicago, about five times a year for the last 20 odd years, and have stayed in most of the downtown hotels. This was my first time at the Residence inn, and was more than pleased with the quality and size of the rooms. All staff were great. Hotel location was spot on for all Michigan Avenue attractions, and only a stones throw from the Theatre district. The fully Inclusive comprehensive breakfast,(7 days) and the evening social meals (Mon -Thu) were first rate. The service given by the Bosnian lady at Breakfast is surely a managers dream. Will be rebooking for my next business trip

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: MaryIN
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice for visitors based on location, size of rooms and overall quality of the property. We visited for a three-day weekend and stayed in a one-bedroom suite. The room was beautiful and impeccably maintained - spotless and the furnishing were in perfect condition. The hotel itself is gorgeous - very urban chic for a place that's priced so well. The pool and workout room are ample and the balcony off the pool looks like it would be gorgeous in the summer (we were there in February). There are tons of restaurants around and the nice little kitchen in the suite means we were able to carry in famous Chicago pizza so we could kick back and relax before heading out again. Parking is spendy, but that's typical of downtown. I would recommend this hotel to families or groups of friends who want to be in the center of the action and still have some room to spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: Palcobaby
Reviews.Content: Residence downtown Chicago was quite a find. Resonable rates, very friendly staff, kitchen with full refrigeratot and stove top. Very clean! Serving breakfast and evening meals throughout the week with Friday exception it was quite a bargan, Only a block or tow off the Lakeshore drive ag reat location for the lady that likes to shop and resturants all over the place for the man who likes to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jagan D
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a duration 2 months and it is an excellent place for stay. The service is good and I am going to soon return to this place for a business visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom21
Reviews.Content: First time back in Chicago in a long time. We had a limited amount of time and were so happy with this hotel. The location was great, plenty of restaurant choices. Near the House of Blues and other bars with some live music which was very fun.. The room was very clean and confortable. The kitchen was a great addition, great to have for a noon time snack. The hotel was very crowded with some young cheerleading competitors when we were there, but our location was very quite, and the breakfast was plentiful for all. I was impressed with the staff and how well they managed such a large group as well as the individual guests perfectly. Would stay again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Bridget O
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent property and great location. Everything we wanted to do was within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erin M
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious with a big kitchen and comfortable sofa. The complimentary breakfast in the morning sealed the deal. It was very close to the mag mile for great shopping! Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: SailKy
Reviews.Content: Our stay this past weekend was our second at this hotel. We selected it last year based upon its excellect ratings by prior guests, and it lived up to its reviews. It is rated similarly to hotels for which you would pay a much higher price. I echo other reviewers, the staff makes a big difference --- from the time you pull up and are greeted by the doorman to your checkout when the front desk staff asks when they will get to see you again, and seem to mean it. As has been said, the breakfast is not gourmet, but what a treat to have a hot breakfast included with a big city hotel stay. And the staff insists upon making your waffle for you, and bringing it to your table --- again, just those little touches. They will see us again our next stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic amenities, service and value.”
Reviews.Author: la_petit_kim
Reviews.Content: Everything was great overall. We rode the Megabus to Chicago to attend a concert, so our trip was very short. But location-wise, this hotel was perfect for us. A quick cab ride from Union Station (maybe even walk-able in the the summer) and a quick cab ride to the club. The room (basic studio w/ king bed) was clean and spacious - large enough for 4 people to hang out comfortably! Wi Fi was free, as was the breakfast, always a nice bonus. Breakfast had a nice mix of hot choices (make your own waffle, eggs, etc) and grab n go choices (bagels, yogurt, fruit, cereal). The service & staff were all nice and very helpful. I was extremely impressed with what we got for the price - outstanding value!

Reviews.Title: “What a friendly place”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: This is a great staff! Everyone, I mean everyone from the valet parking staff to housekeeping to the person clearing tables at breakfast gave us a sincere hello or good morning. A typical Marriott property- clean, up-to-date, and nice but the staff sets this place apart. Not the typical big city approach. If you can stay here and they will make your stay very comfortable. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Savannah M
Reviews.Content: Overall, the service was awesome. The staff was quick to answer all questions before, during, and after our stay with them. It is located in the middle of downtown Chicago, which allowed us to explore the city without much travel.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: richrod212
Reviews.Content: Awesome Hotel! The rates were great. This location is near many great restaurants within walking distance. The service was great and the rooms are modern and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect hotel for our family”
Reviews.Author: mbflyflyaway
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Residence Inn North Loop hotel in Chicago. We opted not to rent a car due to the pricey cost to park, and instead walked the city (with the occasional taxi when it was too cold/far). What a great property! Just across the river from all the downtown city sights. This building houses both the Residence Inn as well as the Springfield Suites. The lobby is one floor above street level - check in is separate for each hotel. We had a minor issue with the toilet during our stay and the maintenance man showed up almost instantly and made sure the problem was gone. He was very pleasant and surprisingly quick considering it's a 27 story building. Typical Residence Inn studio room, everything looked well kept. Our kids slept on the pullout sofa and had no complaints, though the studio is a little tight of course with the bed pulled out. Great view of the city out our window. We checked out the pool on the top floor - but didn't use it. Looked great, and surprised that no one was in it considering how many rooms are in the hotel. Breakfast was standard RI fare, with very friendly attendants making waffles on demand and adding chocolate chips to them on request! Would definitely return if we head back to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Home/Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie H
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel. It felt like home! The staff was friendly, even when working on the holidays. Rooms were comfortable, spacious and welcoming. Breakfast was great. Coffee was always available. Printing service in the lobby was fast and easy. About the only bad thing I can say is that housekeeping did not speak a word of English and therefore, couldn't understand what I was asking for at all when I needed things.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: kugoose
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of Residence Inns this past year and many other Marriott hotels. I traveled with my family over the holidays to Chicago and Residence Inn with the suite concept is the only way to go. I read some reviews about the lady who works the breakfast area, and all of them had positive things to say. I would completely agree with all the reviews. The lady was extremely personable and very interactive with all the guests. If she could help you in any way, she did. One morning, toward the end of the breakfast time, she went table to table checking on all the patrons and even started to deliver stuff to people. She was amazing. The managers should give her a raise, because I would return to the hotel just because of her treatment of the guests. On my two interations with the front desk staff, they were very cheery and provided for a positive experience. The room was very clean and quiet. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great people”
Reviews.Author: LCHH
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! The staff is friendly, we especially love the breakfast hostess, Ismeta. She is just wonderful to everyone! Great location and reasonable, especially considering breakfast and dinner come with the room. Rooms are clean and well equipped. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Small town in the big city”
Reviews.Author: Clubbing
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel the week between Christmas and New Years. It was very full and busy and I think the front desk got a little overwhelmed. This also made for sometimes long waits for the elevator and breakfast. That said, the rooms were wonderful, the location was perfect and the staff, especially Ismeta at breakfast, were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and it is great. (They only time I book another hotel is when this one is full.) The rooms are huge with nice views of the surrounding area. There is a new parking deck attached to the hotel, so access is easy. The staff is friendly and the happy hour free beer is a plus. Location is great, within walking distance to many wonderful restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Sundance1
Reviews.Content: Loved this clean and spacious hotel in the heart of Chicago. Lives up to the Marriott name. Very happy with room. Comfy beds. Even though right downtown, didn't hear traffic. Einsteins Bagels downstairs for easy breakfast. Stayed at this hotel two nights for a Notre Dame game in November. Easy drive to the game. Close to several restaurants. Very Cold. Take your long unders. You'll need them!

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Love...”
Reviews.Author: sandyjeff
Reviews.Content: While this hotel may not be located right in all the hustle and bustle of Michigan Ave., that is actually a good thing. The location still has plenty to offer - Harry Carey's across the street and more restaurants and bar/clubs less than 1/2 block away. One of the major pluses is parking. There is a "green" parking garage attached and we received a discounted rate for being guests of the hotel; every little bit helps in Chicago! We stayed in a "studio suite" which is basically a standard room with a kitchenette. There are only three of us and this was plenty of room. But no division (which I was aware of when I booked) and when the sofa bed was out, manuvering around was tricky. And while this is not solely a problem of the Residence Inn; I wish hotels would realize that whoever sleeps on the sofabed actually needs a good night sleep too - my 11 yro daughter dreads anytime she has to sleep on one. (And no, she's not the Princess of the Pea fame). But I digress. Breakfast is exceptionally busy but the wonderful lady who runs it (as of October 2011) is amazing! The weekday fare is better than the weekend with more variety and time for replenishing. But no matter what she greeted you like you lived there and tried to accomodate any way she could. Lastly, I felt the room was clean for the amount of traffic these rooms see. I would absolutely stay at the Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay like my home.”
Reviews.Author: Bergerac95
Reviews.Content: center of the city and stay like a home. very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Yep, Residence in as a 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: bonchance_8
Reviews.Content: We frequently stay at this hotel when in Chicago. Location is perfect for loop and Michigan Avenue. Many excellent restaurants are only a few feet Away. The staff here is on the ball. Room will be right. Morning breakfast service is so good that guests sit there laughing. Ismeta will find you and take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “One Employee can make the experience”
Reviews.Author: rainman71
Reviews.Content: Amazing! That is the only word I can think of to describe the friendliness and professionalism of Ismeta. My daugther fell in love with her in just the few days we were there. She always wanted to make sure we were taken care of at breakfast. The one morning she knew we were travelling and got us cereal to go. The facilities are very clean. Pool and hot tub are a little small, but nice view from the 27th floor. Location is extremely convenient to nearly anything you would want to do. I highly recommend this hotel if you are travelling with family and want to be close to River North / Magnificent Mile area.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast - the most important meal of the day.”
Reviews.Author: RushDog
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago every year for a convention. The hotel in which we usually stay was full so we picked this instead. We were not disappointed. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, and the location is great. We had to use the services of Colleen, the night engineer, after one of us got very sick in the bathroom. She handled the problem with professionalism and tact. No review of this hotel would be complete without mentioning the breakfast hostess. She is attentive, cheerful, and readily admits that she loves all of her guests. You'll leave breakfast with a smile on your face.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, and Grear Property”
Reviews.Author: TysonBeatty
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and found myself in Chicago for what will be a prolonged stay into February of 2012. The staff is amazing and always very friendly. No matter the time of day or night. The cleaning staff does a wonderful job of servicing the rooms and ensuring everything is in good order. I have not personally had to worry about any sort of maintenance needs, however I did over hear a couple of others mention how quickly their broken TV was corrected. The breakfast and Weeknight Dinner Socials are always good quality food as well. Not the normal "hotel breakfast" type food! And where else includes free drinks with dinner for residence! I could move to my choice of properties in the Chicago area but choose to stay where I am at the Residence Inn. I use them this trip and any future trips to Chicago I know where I will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: likeadeer
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend on a girls trip with my mom and sister. The Residence Inn far exceeded my expectations. The rooms are very warm and cozy. The general manager made us feel at home. I look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, they care”
Reviews.Author: JohntheLast
Reviews.Content: i've stayed in a lot of hotels and this one although part of a chain seemed really concerned that my stay and their services were up to par. Numerous times during my three day stay, I was asked (without being intrusive) whether they were doing a good job and whether I needed anything. Truly surprising. The location of this hotel is also very good, just blocks of Michigan, in the River north area so transportation and restaurants are just out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Work and play”
Reviews.Author: llamamamaof2
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband on his business trip and stayed at this hotel. There were a lot of business people in the hotel but I did also see a few families. We had a king corner suite room which had a great view. The room did not have alot of space as kitchen was when you walked in and kept turning around the sides of the building. Plenty of room for 2 but would have been cramped with a kiddo too. The fitness center was good and had multiple cardio pieces and a weight set. The breakfast was hot and fresh. I couldn't wait to meet the breakfast lady everyone has talked about and she was as good as promised. She seemed to really know the people that had been staying awhile for work and was trying to push food on you!! The evening snacks and drinks are a nice touch. The hotel is in a good locations for places to eat and getting to the shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel & Fair Rates”
Reviews.Author: DickyB_Cleveland_OH
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at this Residence Inn and our weekend stay was great. We know the area well. We love all the action in the River North section of town. The room was large with a bedroom, sitting room and kitchen. It was super clean with all the amenities. We had five people in the sitting room for a visit and we could have held 5 more. The price was very reasonable (even though Chicago rates are getting pretty high). A great quality to price ratio. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful without getting "in your face". We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “No need to look any further!”
Reviews.Author: Icheckeditout
Reviews.Content: Price value of this place is right on. Impeccable service throughout and the location is perfect to enjoy Chicago. Most must to do's are in walking distance. The rooms are very comfortable with a little kitchen attached. Nice breakfast bar and lots of personal attention by Ismetha. They have social hour weekday's serving free food and drinks. The entire staff makes you feel very special and they will go the extra mile for you. Very well managed place. If we come back, this is the only place we will stay, period!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed <3”
Reviews.Author: Katinka1975
Reviews.Content: It took so many hours choose hotel in Chicago. But we couldn't choose better. If you look hotels in Chicago, take this and you will have great hotel stay. The front desk was always friendly and helpful. And the hostess, she is amazing. The breakfast have plenty of items and it was very tasty... Our room was very clean, having much space. There was also large refrigerator. Location just great! We would definitely choose this hotel if we are coming back to Chicago again! Stayed for 5 nights from 25 October. Certainly recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MargaretJay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for 3 nights from 24 October. Couldn't fault it. Had a one bedroom suite on 15th floor. None of problems others may have mentioned, wifi was excellent and free, lifts fast and as we were high up our situation was above the parking garage so had a reasonable view. This was the fifth Marriott we have stayed in over the last five weeks of a 12 destination trip in USA: three Courtyards and two Residences! Overall prefer the Residences as they give you the option to prepare meals which is something of a change when you're travelling around a lot. The weekday evening reception is very good and if you don't want to eat out or cook a meal, provides sufficient food for a meal. (In other hotels they just tend to provide snacks or canapes with drinks, this was so much more. ) We tended just to have a drink as being vegetarian there was little for us to eat, but this is not unusual. This Residence is very comfortable, clean, and welcoming and in its design and layout fully met our needs. All staff were lovely and seemed to genuinely want to help/make our stay as pleasant as possible. We were able to walk everywhere (though we did get one day passes for the EL we hardly used it as it was often easier to walk. Very convenient for Michigan Avenue. A number of hotels we have stayed in on this trip have been more expensive and grander to the point of being pretentious. Nothing like this here: excellent value for money and certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Marcela956
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at Residence Inn Chicago Downtown River North during my recent trip to run the Chicago 2011 Marathon, my first marathon. Since me and my family checked in, we felt at home, and it was so important to feel that way, in order to get ready for the big event...running my first marathon. Breakfast was great...the hostess ...even better..that woman really likes her job, and treated all runners, every mornig life if we were kings and queens...On the running day, breakfast was ready at 5 am, one hour earlier...so we could all could have proper food before the race. Another great amenity was the evening happy hour...great food, and beverages for all the hotel guestss..that is really awesome, and difficult to find in that sort of hotels... I will certainly will come back and I am recomending it to some friends who are traveling to Chicago ...soon.

Reviews.Title: “A JEWEL OF RIVER NORTH”
Reviews.Author: PDXBigGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights on a recent business trip and was simply wowed by everything about this hotel, from the genuinely friendly service to the great amenities. This will be my first choice for visiting Chicago. PROS: -ISMETA: wonder woman/supermom of breakfast service. Simply have never seen anyone as friendly, helpful, and genuinely kind working in a hotel. Can she be cloned? In fairness, all employees that I encountered here were very friendly. -breakfast and "light" dinner food. The oatmeal, eggs, and potato "pancakes" were wonderful. At dinner (M-Th), the rotating menu was substantial enough so I didn't have to go out for a real dinner. One night was great split pea soup and the next was lasagna. They also serve soda, beer, and wine--all complimentary! -location: 2 blocks from the Blue line (Lake and Clark) or 3 blocks from the Red line (Grand and State) CTA trains. No need for a shuttle from O'Hare, unless you have a lot of luggage. Great restaurants within easy walking distance. -wired and wireless HSIA in room (slow but acceptable) -very nice fitness center on the top floor, much bigger than average. -clean, spacious room with full size fridge, microwave, and cooktop. (no oven)-typical of Residence Inn CONS: -analog programming on HDTV. Many guests are on extended-stay at Residence Inns, so TV-watching IS important. -very tiny TV in bedroom (had a 1 bedroom suite.) Very odd, have never seen a 15" set (looks as a computer monitor) in the bedroom and a large normal set in the living room. Suspect space issue in the bedroom was the reason. -charge for local phone calls -elevator key: good for security but always takes 2 or 3 swipes before it would work. By the way, the elevators are super-fast.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Marriott- Ignored”
Reviews.Author: Brad K
Reviews.Content: 10-20-11 My Profile... Not near an elevetor High Floor please Neither, 4th floor viewing the parking deck. Lots of honking, tire squeaking, horns, elevator noise, loud guests. Poor Service when entered and basically they ignore the business traveler and cater to the unknowing foreign or out of state tourist. Dont bother from a person who travels 200 nights a year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff makes you feel very welcome”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 12 days and really enjoyed the staff at this hotel. The front desk was always welcoming and helpful. I got a bad cold and had to buy some cold medicenes and they would always say, "feel better" and even ask the next few days after how I was feeling. The woman who runs the breakfast is fantastic! She remembers and acknowledges everyone, hugs the kids, feeds you anything you want. She's a treasure. The room was very clean and well kept. TV channels are just so so. Internet was good. I'm returning for other projects and have asked to be placed in this Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: PastaboyMI
Reviews.Content: One name, Ismeta! She was the bomb. My kids loved her. She really makes you feel at home. Definitely recommend a stay at RI.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: allworldtickets
Reviews.Content: Went for the weekend with my 78 year old mom and my husband. We needed a suite hotel and this fit the bill. The free breakfast was very good. Not gourmet, but lots of healthy options. The 24 hour coffee bar in the lobby was also a great perk. The room was nice and having a large refrigerator was great. If I needed a suite, I would stay again. Also, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in River North!”
Reviews.Author: acciodogs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for business in October 2011. Location was great, rooms were clean, fitness facility was solid and the staff was quite helpful. Will return on future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TheshoesCamas_Wa
Reviews.Content: I do not have one bad thing to say about our stay here. Probably the only tthing close to a complaint is the elevators can take a while sometimes. The hotel is centrally located. we took the Blue Line from O'Hara and only walked a few blocks. We were also able to catch the CTA buses close by. Lots of eats close by too. We were here for the marathon and were able to get around town just fine. One exceptional point sounds a bit goofy, but the lady that is in charge of the breakfast here is awesome! there is plenty of good food and she says hi to literally everyone in this busy dining area. The hotel also hosts happy hours regularly with food and beverages. Could very well substitute for a dinner in most cases.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer J
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here every year for the past 3 years when we go to Chicago. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast is wonderful especially when we get to see Ismeta, she really goes above and beyond her duties. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for animals!!”
Reviews.Author: Bjfahs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 dogs and our 2 year old. It was great. The staff was so friendly! It was stylish, very clean and roomy. We had a one bedroom that had every thing we needed! They were so nice to our dogs. There was also a great free breakfast evey morning. The only bad part was the parking. We had a trailer and suv. It was going to be $160 for 2 nights parking. We parked 3 blocks away and still payed $120.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyDerbygirl
Reviews.Content: We go to Chicago for family weekends several times a year and have stayed at many of the "best" hotels along Michigan avenue. This trip we were scrambling to find a hotel room for Friday and Saturday nights on Friday afternoon. We stumbled upon this residence inn with great ratings on trip advisor and a very good nightly rate so we decided to give it a try. I can promise that this will be our new home base in the Chicago area. I want to start by saying that Ismeta, who runs the breakfast area, absolutely made our day with her breakfast! We felt like personal friends of hers and she went out of her way to take care of us! (Yes, we only met her on Saturday morning!!!) The whole hotel had a friendly vibe, from the front desk to the doorman! The location was great for walking to all the great shopping and tourist areas along Miracle Mile, and a great location for finding new restaurants! Our room was very clean and felt new. I was pleased that there was plenty of hot water for our family showers and I felt like this hotel was quieter than many we have stayed at in this area. We will definitely return to this Residence Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Res Inn Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Don A
Reviews.Content: Residence Inn Chicago River North is a great value. Excellent location near Mich Ave shops and near north restaurants & bars.

Reviews.Title: “Center of Chicago's North End - Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: MCPO-USN-2011
Reviews.Content: Had a one day layover for a connecting AMTRAK trip to Florida, and staying at this property, among the numerous hotels in the area, was a perfect choice. Location on Dearborn is close to everything......Navy Pier is a bit of a walk - but, shopping, tours, and food are all close by. Property is maintained very well (looks brand new). Elevators are fast, rooms are spacious. There is a supermarket and 7-11 nearby to stock up the kitchen in the room. Breakfast *is* included, and very nice. The staff is very friendly (yes, friendly in Chicago) - esp Michael and Katie at the front desk (I requested a late check-out, due to the late departure of my train, and they eagerly accomodated my request). Fitness, Pool and Laundry are on the 27th floor, so you have a nice view while you are up there. Beds are very comfortable. Room walls are solid (heard NOTHING from the other rooms or hallway). And the views----are awesome (I had a Lake View/Dearborn Ave side room on the 16th floor). Bathroom is roomy, glass shower. I had no complaints during this stay. The location, the staff, the rooms, the price - - you can't go wrong at the Residence Inn North.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: RichL46
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at this hotel; our first stay at a Residence Inn. As we were checking in, I mentioned the positive reviews on tripadvisor. Shortly after, we were advised that we were the â€œGuests of the Dayâ€� and were presented with a nice goodie bag. This hotel does a business with long-term guests and the rooms are designed to accommodate their needs. I think that you could be very comfortable staying at this hotel for an extended stay. The room was spacious and had a very comfortable King Size Bed. Although we did not use them, the stovetop, microwave and refrigerator could come in handy for those staying in Chicago for longer periods. We used the hotel as a base for exploring Chicago. Itâ€™s in a very convenient location and served our needs perfectly. On arrival day, we walked up Michigan Ave. and took the train up to Wrigleyville to catch a Cubs game. With our one full day in town, we walked to Buckingham Fountain and then back up to Oak Beach. On our departure day, we walked to the Gold Coast and Old Town areas. The included breakfast was probably the best that weâ€™ve ever had. As mentioned, the plus was the service provided by Ismeta. She greeted every guest and offered to make a waffle for my wife (thatâ€™s usually a DIY). She is truly an asset. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Andy O
Reviews.Content: We had the corner Studio Suite with a king size bed and a pull out sofa bed. The bed was very comfortable. The room had a view from two different sides of Chicago. It looked very nice at night. The room was very clean and updated. The room also had a small kitchen that included a small stove, refrigerator, cabinets, microwave, utensils, pots, pans, cups, coffee machine, and a sink. The room also had a little desk area with chairs and offered free wifi. The bathroom area is shower only (with a glass door that looked pretty nice) and had a toilet. The bathroom sink area is right next to the bathroom area and can be separated by the bathroom door so a person could take care of business without disturbing someone else who would like brush their teeth or hair. The sink had three drawers, very well lit, large mirror, and electrical outlet. The only downside to this room is that it is very small. I would recommend this room for two people only. If you do come with three or more be prepared to have no privacy because the fold out sofa bed is right by the foot of the king size bed. When the sofa bed is open there is about 3-4 inches from the bed to the sofa bed. The hotel does offer parking. A person could either park themselves for $38 or have valet do it for $48. We chose valet just for the convenience. It was nice to come out of the hotel and have our car waiting for us. Breakfast everyday was a treat. The hostess was so pleasant. She greeted each and every person everyday. She made her rounds to every table just to ask how everything was. It really made the start of your day in Chicago. The breakfast area was a buffet style breakfast and offered a wide variety of breakfast foods. It offered eggs (two different styles), sausage patties, French toast, pancakes, cereals, bagels, pastries, hash brown like potatoes, waffles (made on the spot), jellies, cream cheese, butter, coffee, apple juice, orange juice, milk, fruit, and I am sure I am missing a couple of other things. The place does get filled-up pretty quickly. I would recommend coming early if you have four or more in your party. Dinner time around the hotel is great too. There are so many places to eat around the hotel. We went to an Italian restaurant (about ten min from hotel) that when you ordered one entrÃ©e they gave you another entrÃ©e to take home with you. It was crazy. It was like two for one and the price was very reasonable. All in all, this hotel was very nice, clean, and affordable. It comes with a variety of amenities. We really enjoyed our stay. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast hostess, TERRIBLE sofa bed”
Reviews.Author: jnb2375
Reviews.Content: I slept here on a sofa bed (yeah, I know, my mistake) for 2 nights. It was literally the worst thing I have ever slept on. If I had been 100% confident in the cleanliness of the floor, I would have moved to the floor. It was that bad. Springs sticking out, lumpy, creaky, you name it. The location is great. The breakfast hostess should be put in charge of customer service for all of Marriott. She is amazing. She remembers peoples, greets everyone, and treats everyone like they are a guest in her home.

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms are created equal...”
Reviews.Author: NorCalGirl11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with four friends. Since the rooms only have one bed and a sofa bed, we booked two rooms. Both rooms were booked on the same reservation, in hopes that we would be given adjacent rooms. The first person to arrive checked in and we were given rooms next door to each other, 904 and 906. Due to delayed flights, two of us arrived at nearly 2am, and picked up the keys for 904. My first thought upon walking in to room 904 was that it didn't look much like the pictures I'd seen on the website. But I was exhausted and just wanted a few hours of sleep before breakfast. The next morning I saw room 906, that my other friends were in. It was substantially larger, had more furniture, and looked exactly like the photos on the website. We were happy to have rooms next to each other, were only there for three nights, and spent most of our time out exploring, so we didn't complain about the rooms. Had I only booked one room and been given room 904, I wouldn't have realized the difference. But in booking two identical rooms on the same reservation, I expected to be given two identical rooms. It worked out okay for us. Since we only needed to use the sofa bed in one room, we had three people stay in the larger room (906). I don't think there would have been enough room to move around in the room if the sofa bed in 904 had been open. Overall, our experience was pleasant. Breakfast (especially the staff working breakfast) was fantastic. And the location was perfect for us. I would stay here again, if I could be guaranteed to get a room equal to 906. The pictures I've posted are of 904. 906 looks exactly like the rooms pictured on the Residence Inn website.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: d k
Reviews.Content: Stayed there before, perfect location. feels like you are home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, friendly personnel, clean and great to stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryMattiasArjan
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. The front desk personnel is very friendly. (our three year old loved Bianca). The breakfast gives a rich choice from cereal to waffles, eggs and bacon. One of the employees, Ismeta, runs the whole breakfast with great attention for every person and cares a lot for all the children. Rooms are clean and also the cleaning personnel is very friendly, asking if any extra help is needed and doing more than we asked for. The lower 10 floors are a bit noisy if you are on the parking garage side. Top floors are great.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great location, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: PaulH81
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to Chicago for a getaway weekend. We choose the Residence Inn because of the quality reviews and location. We are really glad we choose the Residence Inn. The location was great in the River North area of Chicago...very close to the River Walk. The front desk staff and bellman were great. More than eager to please us. The breakfast buffet was very good. All in all a great property. Excellent followup post trip by the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: cliffsiler
Reviews.Content: GREAT RESIDENCE INN!!! Breakfast, Managers Social with free beer and wine! Pool, awesome hot tub, fitness room, great laundry and fast elevators!. Hard line and wireless internet too! Great staff service and hospitality and the ladies doing the breakfast and the social are top notch, especially Ismeta! The breakfast is later than most hotels but Ismeta went out of her way to be sure I didn't leave empty handed! The manager's social is pretty basic with salad, crackers, cheese, cold cuts, chicken salad and once they even had lasagna, but the staff was great! The TV channel selection is the absolute pits but the rooms are very nice and fully equipped. The doormen and desk staff are all very helpful and friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Darhazlomina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice spot. You can walk to most shopping areas and restaurants. Loved that it had free breakfast and Internet. I put 4 for service because anytime I called guest services, most of the time they sound annoyed. Like "why is she calling again!" Otherwise, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place it is the only place I want to stay when in Chicago for work.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa F
Reviews.Content: I love this Residence Inn- it so comfortable and cozy. I have to be here every week for work and I love that it has a small little kitchen. I feel like it is a small little apartment. The location is great - you can walk a short distance to almost anything. The staff are very friendly. You would not be disappointed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here was a true "breakfast with a smile"”
Reviews.Author: Liz T
Reviews.Content: I must share the great experience I had staying at the Residence Inn during a recent trip to Chicago. Ismeta, a staff member, greeted every breakfast guest each morning with an extra special smile, "good morning" and service that can not be surpassed. She made my days start out on a great tone each norning. Great convenience to Millenium Park, riverfront, shopping, eating, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: travels4jen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn Chicago Downtown/River North for a week and we were extremely happy with our choice! Had a corner room with a lovely city view, comfortable bed, nice furnishings, always clean, and very quiet! The only minor inconvenience was very limited counter, drawer, and closet space for a room that size (we were in a 'larger' suite). The full breakfast included was wonderful, with a cheerful Bosnian lady making waffles. The evening reception was nice as well...great for a relaxing glass of wine and light snack before heading out for the evening. The staff members were all very cordial and pleasant and greeted us warmly every time we walked thru the hotel. The location is perfect! Close to everything and we easily walked everywhere. The elevators were extremely slow, but that's expected with a bustling hotel. Overall, great accommodations. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: TravelConnoisseurs
Reviews.Content: On a business trip with family. This hotel offers everything we need and more! Good location, surrounded by great restaurants and shopping. Even our 14 year old son has commented on the friendly, helpful staff. The two bedroom units are extremely spacious with fantastic views from every room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jrsykind
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! The free breakfast and manager's reception with beer and wine really added to the value of this hotel. The service was very friendly and the housekeeping was superb. The housekeeper always abided by our wishes to "come back later please", per a magnet we put on the door. Will stay here again, if I'm ever in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: amjared1
Reviews.Content: Flew in for a quick weekend get-together with our son and his family! Loved the location of this hotel as it was a block from Lake Shore anfpd Michigan Avenue. Easybwalk to the metro to go to Wrigley. Nice, metro-style furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Torn Between Three and Four Stars”
Reviews.Author: benfbrown
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Residence Inn using a Marriott Rewards Certificate. So, needless to say, this impacts my peception of value in that I would probably be somewhat more critical if I had spend money on the room. OK, for the good: 1. Location is great. 2. The room was clean, quiet, and everything worked. 3. The lobby was nice. The not as good: 1. As other reviewers have mentioned, the staff are indifferent. Most of them aren't unfriendly per se, they just don't offer any real assistance unless you ask. Once you do ask, some are helpful, some aren't. This goes for the front desk staff as well as the doormen. 2. The check-in procedure set's the wrong tone. The hotel seems to allow for no early check-in so by 3:00 pm there were a lot of people waiting to check in . This creates stress and anxiety for the guest and the front desk staff. They simply need to do better. 3. You have to go to the front desk to check out. I waited in line for 20 minutes just to be told that there was no charge and I could leave. It's 2011; surely there is a way for this property to upgrade to an electronic check out. In summary, there are good things about this hotel but there are also things that are frustrating. I can tell you that the new GM told me via email that he is genuinely interested in improving the level of service so it will be interesting to see if he is ultimately successful. His interest in the feeback of his guests is the reason I am rating this property 4-stars instead of 3.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: luv2travl08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 week. This was perfect location everything was in walking distance.Bus line and the L line are very close. The staff was very friendly any questions we had they were happy to help us. We loved having breakfast there to start our day.The rooms were kept very clean. Pool was great as well as fitness center. They also have washing machines and dryers if you want to do laundry before going home.We found the city of Chicago to be very clean as well as the people were very friendly. When we go back to Chicago we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good accommodations”
Reviews.Author: NJ2Mom
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 night with my 10 year old son. We had a studio suite which was more than adequate, with a view of Harry Caray's for my son the Cub fan! The location was an easy walk from the orange line (from the airport), red line (to Wrigley), and Clark #22 bus line to get you almost anywhere else. I recommend this hotel for location alone. The Spring Hill Suites is actually attached and in the same lobby; our room was one door away from the Spring Hill. If you don't need a full suite / with kitchen, I think their rates are usually a little cheaper and you get the top notch location anyway. It was VERY crowded the weekend we stayed. One negative was that the elevators, as a result, seemed quite slow, and when we got one, it was inevitably crowded. The breakfasts were also quite crowded, it was hard to find a seat. Breakfast was just ok; i could have done with more variety of fresh fruit, and the bagels were kind of sweet and stale for a jersey girl. But it was certainly adequate for us, the coffee was good and my son loved the fresh made waffles. There was a big thunderstorm one night and the power was out for a bit. I received an email later apologizing for the inconvenience, which was a nice touch. Evidently some folks were without AC but we luckily weren't, at least that we noticed. Overall we enjoyed our stay, Chicago is an amazing city and so easy to get around. We never took a cab once. With kids, I recommend Ed Debevics, we also ordered pizza from Giordanos which was delivered right to the room. It was a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, location and service”
Reviews.Author: co_fragment
Reviews.Content: A very good stay at this Residence Inn. The location is right in the middle of Chicago with plenty of variety for shops, entertainment and culture. The rooms were a step up from the normal Residence Inn quality, more modern and trendy, having been done in the last few years I would guess. Very comfortable and clean, with all the added convenience you get in a RI hotel - fridge, microwave, hobs, etc. We got a great view, but I imagine some of the lower rooms (we were 19th) might just be of the building across. I stayed using rewards points so I can't comment on value for money I'm afraid. The one drawback was that a ton of families seemed to be staying there and breakfast was an absolute madhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & Location, Inconsistent Service”
Reviews.Author: NCYankeesFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days with my 2 teenage sons. Overall, the hotel is nicer/newer/cleaner than other Residence Inns Iâ€™ve stayed at. We stayed in a studio suite, which was large enough for the 3 of us, though by day 5 we were starting to trip over each other. We really enjoyed having a fully equipped kitchen and laundry facilities. The only disappointment was that there isnâ€™t much consistency in the professionalism, helpfulness, and knowledge of the staff. Like many other reviewers have said, Ismeta, who works the breakfast buffet, is beyond amazing. She is warm and friendly and really makes you feel welcome, while somehow managing to keep the busy buffet cleaned and stocked. But on the third morning of my stay I knew she had the day off the minute I walked into the breakfast area. It was less than 30 minutes after they started serving breakfast, and there were dirty tables and counters, they were running out of food, and the two young women working the area were standing around talking to each other. Needless to say, I was glad to see Ismeta on the last morning of my stay. My experience with the front desk staff was similar. At check-in, we waited nearly 20 minutes before anyone even came to the desk to greet us. We asked the gentleman who checked us in for directions on 2 separate occasions. Both times he seeemed annoyed and gave very vague directions, not even telling us street names. On another occasion I asked a young woman at the front desk for directions, and she was very helpful, even going as far as highlighting the route for us on a map. The service (or lack of service) we received from some of the employees certainly wasn't up to Marriott's standards, but because the overall experience was good, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway, great value, great location, and great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: GraceEauClaire
Reviews.Content: we loved it there...and that woman overseeing the breakfast buffet with the russian accent is a keeper....hard workers, friendly, please let her know how much we appreciated her making us feel at home. she has dark hair and her basement flooded last weekend, but she is great and is a great ambassador for Residence Inn....she made me blueberry waffles that were great and i saw how she interacted with everyone. you are only as good as the people who work for you and she along with the others were top flight and professional and friendly and fun....the valets, the desk people, the housekeepers all were so much fun and so helpful. but please thank the breakfast lady who never stops moving. thanks again for a great visit to chicago . we will be back at your hotel...I promise.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2603jj
Reviews.Content: good location,great staff,upscale.Will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Tcdish
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many residence inns and this room was very small in comparison. Requests for towels, etc. Required a second telephone call and more than an hour for the request to be met. The reason we gave service a 3 was due to Brita (spelling ?). She is at morning breakfast and is wonderful. She had a very contagious, cheerful demeanor. The rest of the staff could take a lesson in customer service from her.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: USAMan34
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. I prefer Marriott hotels and this Residence Inn is a good example of why. I originally had a one-bedroom/one-bath suite, but asked for an upgrade to a room with two bathrooms. The front desk upgraded us to a two-bedroom/two-bath suite. The suite was on the 26th floor and had several nice corner room views of the city. Overall, the room was a very comfortable, clean place to recuperate between sightseeing excursions, dining out, and going to a White Sox game. My bed was remarkably comfortable. The living room had a wall-sized picture window with a nice view of several of Chicago's skyscrapers. Breakfast was very good. Staff was friendly. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Value”
Reviews.Author: captainlate
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to from O Hare on the L. Blue line to Jackson, switch to red line (going north/Howard) and get off at Grand. Emerge from subway, walk couple of blocks and go left on to Dearborn....will be to your right, and its dual sign will be on your right, catty corner to Harry Caray's. Rooms new and well kept. Spacious. CLEAN! Our view of the garage wasn't great but it only has four sides, and someone gets the less city view side! Breakfast buffet is very nice and Ismata is the best. Friendly, hard working, diligent: my guess is that she will need to move up at Marriott--reminds me of my Algebra teacher who ended up running mathematics for an entire district--same hard working, pleasant demeanor. Hotel is in the middle of everything. Easily accessible to Magnificent Mile shopping (according to my credit card and family usage). We ate at Rockits when we first arrived (1/2 block away)...very good. There's a CVS a few blocks away for all the stuff you couldn't bring with you as a carry on....This is a prime example of placement of an excellent hotel in a great spot, in a great city. Try to do the City Running Tour, #1 on Tripadvisor....you can walk/run less than a mile to the BEAN. Then take the running tour. Go see a CUBS game--take red line and exit at Addison. Boom. You are there. Have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location and Friendly Personnel”
Reviews.Author: unionjack1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights. Great location, close to the river and walking distance to many good restaurants. We had plenty of choices at the free breakfast buffet, hot breakfast, cereal, fruits,juices and waffles. The hostess at breakfast went out of her way to be sure everyone has what they need. Comfortable and exceptionally clean rooms. Definitely would recommend this hotel and we will stay at this location again. Harry Caray's is across the street, great Chicago retaurant. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ChuckAhern
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly standard Residence Inn in terms of decor (which isn't always the nicest), but it was relatively up to date and very clean. It was better than all other Residence Inns I've stayed. I had a large suite which is rare in such a big city, for the cost. Had a great corner room view, and its very close to everything downtown. I don't think you can do better at the 200$ price point. Like most Residence Inns, there isn't room service, but you do have a small little store downstairs with snacks and a full kitchen in the room. They had an evening happy hour with free beer (just pitchers of Miller light) and buffet type food.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: lalevin1974
Reviews.Content: This hotel was oustanding. The building itself is probably a bit nicer than other Residence Inn properties at which I have stayed. This hotel's distinct difference however was the staff. Everyone we interacted with was incredible. From the valet desk helping us find places to eat or things to do to the front desk staff finding us a room even though we got there four hours before check in. All very helpful! The most amazing part of our stay was the woman who runs the breakfast area. My kids fell in love with her and she was amazing! It's the little things that make a hotel worthwhile and this woman made us feel right at home every morning. The rooms were excellent and well maintained. The pool was big enough for the kids to have some fun and the workout facility always had equipment available. I would definitely encourage people to stay at this property. Within walking distance (20 minutes) to just about all of the big Chicago tourist attractions too. Price was very competitive and for what you get at this property your dollar goes much further.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chicago -trip report June 29-July 4th”
Reviews.Author: ccpt95
Reviews.Content: Check in was a little tough - we were very early but the gentleman was kind of unfriendly - he redeemed himself later in the stay by greeting us warmly so maybe he was having a bad day. The breakfast is great. I forget the woman's name but know that it is mentioned here several times - she is wonderful. The rooms are nice, we had a 1 bedroom King with a kitchen - not sure you could really fit more than 2 people here. maybe some really young kids but we don't have kids so just my guess. The bellstaff was nice but not very informed about restaurants, so go knowing about where you should eat otherwise they were very nice and helpful. We arrived on the 29th of June - early then went to Navy Pier- took the free trolley bus but if you have a CTA 3 or 7 day pass there are 2 other buses that travel that route so you can take any of those. Illinois and Grand is closest to the hotel. There is an Osco-Jewel close by there as well if you need groceries. back to the hotel met my sister and her kids for a Cubs game!!!! First time to Wrigley Field! we went early took the Red line to Addison got on at Grand and Lake. They don't open the gates until just an hour before game time I think so we went a bit too early with young kids - however my nephew got picked to go watch batting practice on the field so going early was worth it for us. Not sure how just random and very lucky! great game and getting home was easy - just crowded. the next day we ate breakfast and it was crowded but a great start. we went to Navy Pier with the kids and took a speedboat ride and ate then went to the beach then home for showers and dinner at Harry Caray's across the street which was terrible. drinks were bad and food was not great. overpriced and our waiter was rude. the next day we did Art Institute and Taste of Chicago. bought City Passes which were worth it of you are staying for a few days and can get it all in. went to dinner at Hub 51 but it was just ok - we couldn't get into Frontera Grill which is around the corner and Rick Bayless' restaurant. Just my poor planning - but it was 4th of July weekend and reservations went 2 months prior... Museum of Science and Industry the next day with House of Blues for dinner - it was good and the music was great. Architectural Boat Tour and Shedd were the next day along with dinner at Girl and the Goat - it was awesome! apparently difficult to get a table here as well so we went at 4:15 and they were just opening so we got lucky and got a table t the communal table which was fun! fantastic food! not a place for kids - unless they like squash blossoms and chickpea fritters...no mac and cheese menu/chicken fingers on this menu :) we then went to the skydeck at the old Sears tower now the willis tower. crazy busy. the next day we did the Field museum and then went back to the hotel and picked up our stuff and got on the L for Midway to fly home. You need to leave some travel time for these things - we mostly took the bus after buying the 7 day pass which was very easy to travel on and mostly on time. The drivers on the routes were friendly and helpful in our experience. The City Pass was very helpful as well as it allows to bypass a lot of wait in lines especially at the Shedd so don't buy it there first - go somewhere else buy it then go to the Shedd - that line was always crazy long... We did not do much Mag mile shopping or hang out on Michigan Avenue/shopping places - we were blessed with fantastic weather the whole trip which also made it a bit better I think. hopefully this was helpful- I think we were tired from a lot of walking but what we did was jammed. Not sure if young kids could have done as much in as short a time period - we did see plenty of kids whining at parents to go home...you know your kids best... the flight out of Midway was delayed so we did not take of until 9 pm which was actually really cool because we got to see plenty of fireworks. great trip this hotel was close to transportation and comfortable. could you get closer to transportation - sure but it was fine for us and the free breakfast was a huge bonus. If you stay during the week there are dinners mid week which also might help save money if you are on a budget. happy travels and Go Cubs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views and very very clean”
Reviews.Author: Zmaragdi
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to main shopping district, hop on hop off bus route. Staff were efficient and friendly. Breakfast buffet terrific and staff were very accommodating. We really enjoyed the evening Happy Hour, gave us a chance to catch our breath and enjoy light refreshments and snacks. Rooms good size and very clean. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “European Lady in Breakfast Room - Super Nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: CJBarnett
Reviews.Content: I used reward points to stay at this hotel with my parents. The manager upgraded us to a two-bedroom on the second night. This was greatly appreciated. The hotel is in a great location. The rooms are very clean and smart. The European woman in the breakfast room was the highlight. She went out of her way to make everyone feel welcome. She was a refreshing start to the morning. I highly recommend this hotel. You will be happy with the choice.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay with kids and dog”
Reviews.Author: BrianH40
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night with 3 kids (13, 13, 11) and our dog. We got two interconnecting rooms because anything else was just too small. The rooms are modern well fitted. The staff were great, especially the lady that makes the waffles in the breakfast room, she's great. My only issues were (1) $100 fee for dog, where typically it is only $75 atna Residence Inn, and (2) the hotel is not as close to Navy Pier as we expected. Turns out that we decided to drive to Willis Tower and Navt Pier because it was a bit far to walk and no good public transport options as far as we could see with quick research. A better prepared travel may know better... But still I would be tempted to stay closer to Navy Pier next time.. Fun there for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “ladies getaway...wow can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: grumpygus1
Reviews.Content: Well...if i had written this review a few days sooner it would have been very different. \the general manager had sent an email requesting a follow up response on our trip. I was going to email him but thought i would just call him. \i must admit that he was very understanding and apologized numerous times for our misfortune. I shared with him our problem.. We were 4 ladies coming from Toronto for a 4 day getaway and when we arrived we were told by Michael that apparently our reservation had been cancelled previously...well i can tell you that we didn;t fly to Chicago without a reservation so i am still unsure what happened to our reservation. He worked hard to find us a room unfortunately it took him much longer than it should have and we didn't receive the 1 bedroom suite that we had bboked for but rather a small studio room. The room was very tight and when the sofa was pulled out it actually touched the bed...very close and tight!! We made the very best of our stay and very much enjoyed our trip to Chicago. We must compliment the Manager as i am throughly impressed with Ismeta in the restaurant. | would love to take her back to Toronto and maybe she could teach some of my staff a thing or two. She greeted each guest and had the ability to make waffles, clear tables and communicate with guests. Hats off to Ismelta!!! It is effident that customer service training is provided to the staff as they are very courteous and extremely helpful. The location is wonderful with so many great sites within walking distance. We loved the architecture river cruise and would highly recommend this to everyone. It was worth every penny. Hillary was extremely knowledgeable. I'm so glad that we did this the first night as it gave us a better appreciation of the architecture in the city. we flew into the Midway airport from Porter our Toronto City Airport and would do it again. The staff were very friendly and quick and i would easily travel to this airport again vs going to the big international O'Hare. We hopped on the loop which was a huge cost savings ($2.50 each) The ride was ~ 25 minutes. We splurged on the way to the airport and booked a big surburban for the 4 of us and it was $45 to the airport. Very nice man and again very helpful. Local sites; We went to a local resturant for Chicago pizza and i would highly recommend this place vs some of the well known places like uno or duo pizza (very overrated and not good quality or price) The restaurant recommended by the conceirge was Lou Mahatis. The best pizza we've ever had. We were so surprised that we were able to feed the 4 of us two had a beer for only $50.. we had the special and the vegetarian, salad and an appetiser plate. Amazing pizza. Wish i could find something like that back in Ontario ...pizza pizza seems oh so cardboard like now! Another must for restaurants is the Rocking Rocket down the street from the hotel. Oh my the burger was so good...whoever thought of putting brie cheese on a burger. i can't describe how good the food was the truffle sweet potato fries were the best ever....the place was packed and everyone in our party were over the top thrilled Another great place in the howl to the moon ...not sure what to expect but alot of fun Another great spot to eat is the mitynice in the water tower place. We thought we would just split a salad and a tuna burger wow...supersize me the food quantity was so large and the food was so amazing we had no room left to go Sullivans that nite |(we really were craving a good steak but no room!!). again great food and great service. We also booked a sailboat tour and enjoyed that as well to see the skyline. Millenium park is a must and you must be sure to check out the "Bean" We walked every where as there is so much to see. it is something to see the Loop above ground as our train system in Toronto is a subway with the majority below ground We recommend checking out Groupon great way to save some coin when you're in the city. We all agreed that the ctity was incredibly clean with lots of green space and the locals were sooooo nice... and we thought we Canadians were friendly... Even though it is a big city it has a small town feel. i know this is to be just about the RI but i always love to hear from other people where to go when in a new city. I want to thank the staff at the RI especially David for his very timely response to my concerns regarding our check in. When ever my husband & I travel for business or pleasure we always stay with the Marriott Hotels and would stay again at this property thanks

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Iceler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn Chicago Downtown River North over the fatherâ€™s day weekend in June 2011 and the best way to describe my stay would be to say it was wonderful. The Hotel staff is unbelievable. Two people assisted me when I checked in Jennifer and Michael the night auditor. Jennifer, who I found out is new, has a smile that will warm your very spirit. She is as nice and friendly as can be. We arrived early so she offered to store our bags and took my cell phone number so she could call us when a room on a higher floor was ready. It did not take long, we walked to Harry Carayâ€™s across the street and by the time our beer arrived Jennifer called to tell me that she had a room for us. When we returned we watched as a group of people were giving Michael undeserved grief about not being able to get a large number of rooms, together, on the same floor with an early check in. I could not believe what I witnessed. Michael had every reason to tell the group to take a hike but he was as professional and courtesy as could be and wound up accommodating this unworthy group of malcontents. He then gave us our room and I think we got a little something extra for commenting on how nice he was. It was also a relief to find that he was knowledgeable about the city and attractions and bus routes and greeted me every time we passed through the lobby. The hotel rooms are spacious and well equipped. We had a studio suite and it was spacious. There are pots and pans, dishes a large refrigerator, dishwasher and two-burner stove. They provide a nice iron, not one of those cheap ones and provide soap and shampoo. The complimentary internet is fast enough, the beds are nice, the recliner was great, and there is a table to work on and a table to eat on. When we walked in my girlfriend and out said â€œthis is a nice room! I would clearly take advantage of the complimentary breakfast. They serve waffles, eggs, sausage, juices, coffee and really is would be a waste to have breakfast anywhere else. The days I was there Latoya and Ismeta were working. Both are unbelievable. They are pleasant, friendly and helpful. I told Latoya how I really appreciated her hard work and she responded by saying â€œwe are happy that you are here.â€� Ismeta is legendary as evidenced by all the positive feedback that she receives. She is originally from Bosnia and she loves having a job around happy people in the U.S. It was refreshing! On my second day I arrived after breakfast was closed and Ismeta insisted on getting us fruit and juice. I have to tell you, Ismeta and Latoya are real gems. Finally, the hotel is in a great location. The subway is really close, the bus is right across the street as is Harry Careyâ€™s and the House of Blues. I would definitely take the 22 bus and have sushi at RAâ€™s on Rush Street (happy hour is from three to six) which is a ten minute bus ride away. I would consider taking the bus to Wrigley Field so you can see the Lincoln Park area and Wrigleyville. In sum, this is a superb place to stay and I thought it was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “newer hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: luv2snorkel61
