Reviews.Content: We (husband, myself and 12 year old daughter) stayed in a studio suite for 3 nights and found it to be a very functional room and a nice hotel for us. The king bed was really comfortable and the couch was big and comfy enough that daughter didn't need the pull-out, we just made the couch up as a bed each night. The room and all of the hotel are very fresh and clean. Our room was very quiet even though we knew we had neighbors on both sides. The free breakfast buffet was more extensive than we'd anticipated and they didn't mind that we would grab a couple things to bring up to our room for daughter's late nice snacking (milk, bagel, yogurt, cereal--she's growing fast and hungry all the time). The location was great for using CTA. Bus stops and train stations were all within a couple blocks and Navy Pier/Mag Mile were in walking distance if you didn't want to do public transportation. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room had a kitchen (2-burner stove, full fridge, microwave) that we really under-utilized since we ate out each meal, but it saved us money just by buying a case of water and some pop down the block at CVS (plus having a place to store daughter's snacks). We were really pleased with this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and accomodation for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: rustycat83
Reviews.Content: Just completed 4 night stay at this hotel. The room was well laid out to accomodate 2 adults and two teenagers (separate room with comfortable pull out bed). Provided privacy for both when required, yet open and spacious for full family gathering. Nice kitchen, full size refridgerator, dishwasher, and cooking/eating utensiles. Standard rate including free breakfast, while not great, was adequate for quick bite on the way out the door for tourist activities. Real gem was the service provided by a wonderful lady that worked the breakfast buffet. The only negative was two elevator rides to room: one from street entrance to lobby and then separate from lobby to room floors. Would highly recommend this hotel for families due to value, location, rooms, and service.

Reviews.Title: “They're right!”
Reviews.Author: RinORL
Reviews.Content: You can believe all of the good things other reviewers have said about this property and its staff. Staying there was a great experience in an outstanding location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, food and experience!”
Reviews.Author: GJB21456
Reviews.Content: The location and rooms at this hotel are great for easy access to the sights and sounds that are Chicago. Fantastic assortment of restaurants all easy walking from the hotel. In fact on the best is Hub51 right in the same building. A most popular spot and a visit there will tell you why! Back to the hotel, rooms are great and comfortable with kitchen; complimentary hot breakfast is first class and offers variety everyday with great staff assisting. Certainly a hotel for both business or pleasure when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I felt I know every single person in this hotel like my close family.”
Reviews.Author: Staymourian
Reviews.Content: Every thing you need to help yourself home you can find in this hotel. Staff are so frindly . Esmatha from dinning room , is like your own mom making breakfast and takeing care of you...I have already miss her! i highly recommend this hotel for any sort of trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Denverlily
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spend a week exploring Chicago for fun, found a good rate for this hotel which had good reviews, and we were not disappointed. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was nicely appointed, the bed comfortable, and it was quiet except for one night when neighbors had a 2:00 A.M. party (not the hotel's fault). We had a studio type room, with well-supplied kitchen, table with chairs, couch and arm chair, coffee table and bed tables and lamps on both sides of the bed (important for readers like us). The bath had only a shower (with a great shower head), but no tub, but we don't usually use a tub when traveling anyway. There was not a lot of counter space around the sink but there were a drawer and two shelves, and it worked out well. Bountiful breakfasts and good evening "snacks" (really full meals with salad) on week nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, location, and best breakfast staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: WITravelers33
Reviews.Content: We stay extensively with Marriott brand properties and stayed at this hotel for 2 nights over the holiday weekend. The hotel was in an excellent, convenient location. The rooms were spacious and clean. We did find that it could feel quite crowded at times requiring us to wait in line at elevators for several elevators to go by...or that pool was over run by small children at all times except late at night, and the breakfast room was crowded and chaotic in the last hour 9-10 particularly. But, large high rise hotels often feel crowded in these ways. I would suggest they add a later night "12 and up only" time in the pool so we could enjoy that area in a more peaceful atmosphere. The breakfast staff member, Ismetta, was so very impressive. She had a great attitude and treated each guest like they were visiting her personal kitchen. She had such energy and truly made the chaos of this crowded breakfast room feel warm and inviting. Ismetta is a great asset to this property and for us took this stay from good to great. Thank you Ismetta!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomidations in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: HardPretzel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the perfect location. Just a few blocks to walk to anything in the city, you couldn't ask for a more desirable location. And the staff at this hotel are second to none. Our group was in a pinch and required a little extra assistance for our trip. The group meeting planners and sales staff went the extra mile to ensure our group was well taken care of. If your traveling to Chicago with family for a long weekend or with colleagues for a business trip, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Homehost
Reviews.Content: Well I have to start off with the great breakfast, what makes it special the wait staff serving the breakfast. in particular, a lady by the name of Ismetta, she is simply the best Marriott has to offer! she always looks out for us and takes care of my little children. few months ago my mom stayed at the same hotel not to my surprise she doesnt stop praising her. Great Job Marriott - its home when we are on vacation

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and a great choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bigsur221
Reviews.Content: We recently completed an extended stay at the River North Residence Inn. Over the years our family has stayed at a number of Marriott properties and on business I have personally stayed at a bunch of residence inns, for lengthy stays. This hotel was wonderful, from the clean, comfortable rooms and lobby, to the warm attentive staff. Given the length of stay and the location of the hotel we were concerned about noise but given we had a high facing room (recommended), we had no issues (and a nice view of the city). The morning breakfast was great and I have to call special attention to Ismeta, who has received much positive press on Tripadvisor, but is completely well-deserved. She is a wonderful person who made us feel so at home with her warm greeting, wonderful waffles for our daughter, and attentive service (which I have never expected in the morning at a self-service style breakfast. We would definetely return and recommend this hotel for both short and longer stays. A very well run property which deserves special recognition.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Hotel Stay Perfectly Located & SUPER FRIENDLY Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: jason094
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service and very well kept hotel. Located in the heart of just about any entertainment option you could possibly need

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jolotraveler
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I, who frequent Chicago often for business, stayed at the Marriott for six nights in May. This was our first stay at the Marriott and it was extremely pleasant. All of the staff are friendly and super helpful. The woman who maintains the lobby space during the breakfast hours is extremely nice, a little over the top, but well intentioned. We each stayed in a suite, which came with two roomsâ€”bedroom and living room, and were well decorated with couches, desk and chair, flat screen tvs in the living space and the bedroom, and a great kitchen for cooking, including dishes, pots/pans, and utensils (if only we actually did such a thing!). Overall, great room with more than enough space to place our things. Hotel is in a great location, access to all that downtown Chicago has to offer, including restaurants and shops. The fitness room is also nice, which is attached to a small pool, which kids seemed to like. While the hotel is very business friendly and occupied by various professionals during the week, the hotel got extremely crowded over the weekend and there was nearly no room to sit down and eat breakfast in the morning in the lobby as a result. Besides the crowded breakfast lobby, our only complaints were that: 1) the rooms facing the east side (I think) of the hotel are right next to the garage which undergoes cleaning at some time during the early hours (1-2a), which can be heard in the middle of the night. This disrupted our sleep on more than one occasion and lasted for at least an hourâ€¦it didnâ€™t happen every night, but more than once; 2) the hotel was packed, and with only four elevators, we had to wait a little longer than we would have liked for an elevator. This is a minor inconvenience, but noted.

Reviews.Title: “Best Residence Inn I've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: CACALovetotravel
Reviews.Content: This is really the best Residence Inn I've ever been to. The hotel is very modern, very clean, and the customer service is top notch. I was very impressed with every aspect of this hotel. I did alot of research for a hotel by reading TripAdvisor reviews before choosing this hotel and I am so glad I did. It was convieniently located to everything we wanted to do. The room was like I had my own apartment in downtown Chicago. It was very clean, and the huge windows offered a fabulous view of downtown. The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was great, and there was a woman by the name of Ismeta that greeted us our first morning there offering us a freshly made waffle. (I had a chocolate chip waffle-it was delicious!) I have never been to a RI where I didn't have to make my own waffle. It was a nice touch to have that warm greeting everyday. She asks you how long you will be staying and remembers you everyday you are there. You kind of feel like you are having breakfast at her home. Thank you so much Ismeta! Aside from that, every single employee at the hotel we came in contact with always offered a warm greeting and had the best customer service. Don't give a second thought to staying here, I would recommend it to anyone that asks me. And I will definitely stay here when I come back to visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Newer, spacious, clean and well located, this Residence Inn offers all necessities in a comfortable package”
Reviews.Author: DCDoctor
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean, this Residence Inn feels like a comfortable pied a terre in a great location in downtown Chicago. The well appointed suite lives like a studio apartment, with the added bonus that someone else cleans up after you and that a varied breakfast, with healthy options, is prepared for you. The staff were harried, as the hotel was full, and I did not receive a warm feeling from some of them. Others were managing the volume of work with a smile. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Residence Inn, best staff ever experiment”
Reviews.Author: kikifoufou
Reviews.Content: We stay with my husband for 12 days in Residence Inn Chicago River North. We are used to stay in Marriott's hotels but this one is really a must. All the staff is helpfull and everybody seems to be happy to work here, the mood is so positive. The room was bright, clean, well exposed ( we had a corner studio) and with all you need to feel "like home" The spa on the roof is fantastic. We like everything execpt we would like to see more channels on TV (Comedy or HGTV are our best and we were a little bit desapointed not to have them !). We really enjoy our stay. The hotel is near from everything (good gospel brunch at 2min, good music in Blue Chicago at 5 min, good restaurant at Keefer's just in front...)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: busyasabeeMichigan
Reviews.Content: I have been to downtown Chicago many times, usually staying at either the Residence Inn near the Magnificent Mile or the Marriott....no more!!! This hotel is wonderful. I had a free certificate from the Marriott Credit Card and even though the stay was free they were beyond friendly and accomdating. I am a Gold Member with Marriott and will not stay anywhere else for business or pleasure. The staff is amazing, its clean, modern, great location and the rooms are outstanding. The hotel is connected to a Springhill Suites as well. The valet staff is very nice as well as the bell hops and the front desk staff went out of their way to assist me. The hotel was very quiet and solid. I recommend this hotel to anyone. I work and live south of the city and we went to town for dinner and drinks and hanging out. I also recommend the restaurant near the Palamor Hotel called Sable, nice place with unique twists on American food.

Reviews.Title: “Affordability & Style... with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: kshante
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip. Service was impeccable. Bianca and the other staff members at the front desk were very helpful, friendly and ready to answer any questions with a smile! Located centrally, you're walking distance to everything from great restaurants, shopping and night life. All main attractions and museums are just minutes away. Taxi's are abundant, but since everyting is walking distance, they're rarely needed. All ameneties such as pool, gym, pool and spa are available. Breakfast is included in the rate and complementary drinks are served during the evening. Internet is free. A fully equipped kitchen provides convenience for those who prefer to dine in. A small market area in the main lobby provides any necessities or food items you'd like. The rooms are very affordable and offer a breathtaking view of Chicago downtown. Be sure to reserve a 1 bedroom suite. Leave the curtains open and take in the view!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: CCRJ
Reviews.Content: Residence Inn was in the perfect for location!! We were within walking distance of great shopping, wonderful restaurants, and great night spots! The staff were helpful and friendly! Our room was wonderful! Bed was comfortable, plenty of towels, and very clean! The halls were quiet and we were able to relax! This was our second time staying here, and we will continue to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Davenport_IowaDaizy
Reviews.Content: We went to the House of Blues for a concert and this was basically across the street. Close to many bars, and GREAT eating places! Harry Cary's right across the street Service friendly and great

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthCostGuy
Reviews.Content: The location was great, close to restuarants and just enough off of the Miracle Mile that you don't feel under the swarm. Parking is $42 a night, well within the market price for downtown chicago, but an amount that will need to factor into your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: prowlers3
Reviews.Content: To echo another reviewer, this hotel has the best service of any hotel I have EVER been in. (And we travel quite a bit.). This place should be a mandatory case-study in customer service. Perfectly situated in downtown Chicago, rooms were spacious, breakfast was a feast and every staff person, (really, every single on), was polite, friendly and helpful. The fitness facilities are surreal- I loved working out in the early morning, looking out over the Chicago skyline. We will definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service I have ever received”
Reviews.Author: JimHager
Reviews.Content: I recently held my sales training session at the Residence Inn on Dearborn Ave in Chicago. The facility had the most responsive staf I have ever dealt with. The staff even managed to have a 800 lb air compressor delivered to the upper floor meeting room, and stored it for 3 days until I could arrange for a truck to pick it up for shipment. They went out of their way to make sure the entire conference was a success. I was so delighted with the staff that I have already booked future training sessions at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Residence Inns, extremely friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Maxine3618
Reviews.Content: Recently relocated to Chicago. Good Location for shopping and restaurants. Staff was very kind and helpful. Especially would like to recognize the people at breakfast and at the social hour. Good breakfast and feel the hotel is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: tfehler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn for 2 nights with a group of families and their gymnasts. We worked with Allyson for our group reservation and was great to work with. She made sure everything was great. We have dinner and breakfast at the hotel and I have to say that Ismeta was amazing at breakfast time. Ismeta greeted us each morning and ran around to make sure we were taken care of. The day of the gymnastics meet the girls and their families all had breakfast before we left, Ismeta made sure that each girl had fruit and yogurt as well as spoons to take to the meet with them for energy in a little bag just their size. She tried to get the kids to eat one more bite and had fun with them as well. I noticed that she truly loves her job and it is such a relief to see someone enjoy working. I hope the hotel knows what an awesome employee they have in her. The only downfall of the hotel was the size of the rooms in the corners. We had a corner room and it was a tight fit for 4 of us but others in our group had one further down in the hallway and it was huge for the same type of room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JustUs19020
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic- clean rooms, walking distance to almost everything, great lobby, but has completely sold us with their amazing and friendly service. From the moment we pulled up, the staff was friendly and accomodating; they went out of their way to make sure we had a great stay. The valet came right up to our car, found someone to help with our bags, and sent us to the front desk, where they made check-in a breeze. Staff had the best reccomendations for dining and nightlife, and woman who handles breakfast for the guests was absolutely amazing. The staff absolutely sells the experience, and because of that alone, we are sure to make this our regular place to stay when visiting Chicago. Would be the perfect place to stay, whether you are staying alone for one night, or for a week with the family. The only single problem was that we and our friends (who were in another room) thought the rooms could get a bit hot/ stuffy, but easily relieved by cracking the window a bit. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: love4theIslands
Reviews.Content: Me and my family including two toy poodles stayed here the weekend of January 21, from stepping foot on the property was greeted by everyone and I mean everyone. The Hotel staff are well trained, and the rooms where great. The breakfast food and service was Great. I would like to give a big shout out to "Isemeta" she was the best, greeted us each morning to breakfast as if we where family so did the rest of the crew that team is the best I have seen. Did I say Isemeta has the best customer skills I have seen in a long long time, take care of her Marriott you have a Gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and warm service.”
Reviews.Author: sabrina925
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate my daughters and nieces birthdays and do an American Girl trip. Hotel worked well for us, we had two rooms with 5 adults and 4 kids. We booked here for location and the fact that there was a pool. Kids loved the pool, although we adults found it too cold. Rooms were fine, maybe a little on the worn side but very large. Wonderful breakfast was included and we took advantage of it both mornings. What we all found so lovely about this Residence Inn was the staff. They were amazing! The bell hop was so wonderful to us during our entire stay that one of the girls named her new Bitty Baby doll after him and another named her doll after the front desk attendant. My four-year-old niece woke up exceptionally early one morning and the breakfast had not been set up yet, however the staff went to the back and brought her out a bagel and juice. Super sweet at 5:45am!! The older girls like that there were games to play in the lobby, and my sister-in-law and I enjoyed a glass of wine all in a great setting. Found a great rate on the Marriott website, much better then on any of the travel sites.

Reviews.Title: “This place is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Yoshi-PV
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here between Christmas and New Years and loved it. The rooms were clean. Breakfast in the morning was always great and lots of variety. The staff were always friendly. Location was great as well. We did like having the lobby not at ground level as we could sit around safely and look down at the streets. Their was also a great Eisteins Bagle Restaurant that you can access without going outside! My kids only comment is they wished there would have been Disney Channel or Nick on the TV!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: bronzebabe
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The suites were clean and well appointed with a full refrigerator and stove. The hotel offers free grocery shopping!!!!! Beds were amazingly comfortable. The staff is unusually accommodating and always pleasant. I loved their work out facility which had a laundry just a few steps away. I could do my laundry while I was working out. There is a breakfast buffet each morning and a manager's themed horsdoerves in the evening with wine and beer which, often times was enough for dinner. A selection of restaurants are attached to the bottom floor of the hotel. Many others are within a short walking distance. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “best value for visitors in chicago”
Reviews.Author: ptwholland
Reviews.Content: Most reasonable price and ideal location between downtown State street and Michigan miracle mile stores, restaurants and sites. Free full breakfasts which saves a lot of money and time before business or tours. There is this very nice lady breakfast hostess, Ismeta, who we have noticed the last two years who is very gracious and attentive to every guest. She deserves our gratitude and the hotel's for her dedication and seeming love for her job and the hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Stuart153Seaforde
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful visit to Chicago. Could not fault the Residence Inn in any way, the staff, the room, housekeeping, breakfast, evening meal/drinks reception (Mon-Thur) are all excellent, as is the Hotel's location for access to Clarke/Lake - blue line to O'Hare Airport and also for the sights. Incredibly easy to get around the city on foot from this fantastic hotel. Theater Land and the Magnificent Mile are only a very short distance away. The hotel was in great condition and very clean and tidy. The bed was also very comfortable and the air conditioning worked well. My wife and I were over in Chicago to celebrate my wife's birthday and we were very kindly given a free upgrade to a corner suite that had a lovely view of the city. We were also allowed to check out late as our flight back to Dublin was not until 7:15pm. A fantastic experience from start to finish and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Chicago. We hope to be back in Chicago some time and we will be staying right here in the Residence Inn Downtown/River North. The gym is a real bonus and has a good view over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel pricey parking”
Reviews.Author: przybylski1
Reviews.Content: Residence Inn can always be counted on for a good nights stay. Breakfast was as expected though a little crowded in the set up. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location is great and close to many restaurants and theatres. Parking is expensive though convenient. Room was a nice size for downtown Chicago. Real blankets would have improved the sleep. As an fyi, booked my room on Orbitz and was told Marriott rewards may not be credited because I used a third party.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, service and accomodations"”
Reviews.Author: MnDaisy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an easily accessible location from the Orange Line (Clark/Lake stop) from Midway Airport. We couldn't believe how cheerful and helpful the staff were. The complimentary breakfast buffet offered healthy and plenty of items. The evening gathering of complimentary drinks and snacks was also generous. Our room faced the parking garage, no view but exceptionally quiet which is the preferrable of the two options. Easy walk to museums.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: Mylilee
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out perfect for our first trip to Chicago. I felt that the hotel was centrally located and we were close to the Clark/Lake subway stop which made transportation to and from the airport a breeze. All the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They served a full breakfast every morning which made a nice start to our day. I would definitely stay here again. The only negative to the hotel is that it is very close to the fire station so if you are a light sleeper the whistles throughout the night might be a problem. However, I feel that the good outweighed the whistles.

Reviews.Title: “Get a 2 room suite with full kitchen at reasonable price for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: PK_Maryland
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel. We had a 2-room suite at a reasonable rate for Chicago. The rate was equivalent to or less than comparable one-room hotels. The bedroom is a completely separate room with its own large flat-screen TV. The living area includes a full kitchen with a full-size refrigerator, computer desk, eating table, couch, lounge chair, and large flat-screen TV. The kitchen is stocked with dishes, glasses, utensils, etc. The room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was excellent. The maid would ask us when we wanted our room made up if she saw us in the mornings. The maid service was very responsive to my request for a new hair dryer when I had a problem with the one in the room. The breakfast buffet was average but since it's included in the price of the room, we can't complain. There was plenty to eat at breakfast and the hotel lady who worked the breakfast buffet each morning was super friendly and attentive. She couldn't have been nicer. They also offer complimentary beer/wine and lite fare in the evenings (at least during the week, not sure about weekends). The front desk staff was flexible about letting us check out late on our last day. We suggest that you ask for a room on the higher floors as your view will be much better the higher you go. We were on floor 15 even though we had been offered the 24th floor. We didn't realize the view on the 15th floor would be partially blocked by a parking garage outside our window. Another tip is that if you take public transporation from the airport, take the CTA Blue Line to the Clark&Lake stop and it's a relatively easy walk to the hotel from there (about 3 blocks). Don't take a route that transfers from the blue line to the red line just to get a block closer because the walk to do the transfer from the blue to red line is very unpleasant - up and down stairs and through a smelly dirty tunnel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT all the way around!!”
Reviews.Author: Roadie56
Reviews.Content: We spent our 25th anniversary the past weekend in this fabulous hotel. You can tell the staff has been trained on customer service. EVERYONE from the desk clerks to the guy running the vacuum in the hall stops what they're doing when you pass, smile, and greet you with SINCERITY, not some fake sense of having to. When they discovered it was our anniversary they upgraded us to a corner/king room. Typical of Marriott, the beds were comfortable and pillows just as good as home. I've NEVER stayed at a hotel like this that you thought you had NO neighbors as there was no sound travel whatsoever. The hotel was spotless and looked VERY recently renovated. The management and staff of this property should be very proud of what they've built.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtraxler
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be ideally located in downtown Chicago. The rooms though a bit small as expected for a Metropolitan Hotel were very comfortable and functional.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly088
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from staying at this hotel for 4 nights. We were visiting Chicago for our anniversary and have to say we absolutely loved the city. The hotel couldn't have been in a better location, close to everything. Even though we had our car, we didn't really need it. Great restaurants and bars within 1 block of the hotel. With respect to the hotel, we were just a little dissappointed. After a 10 hour drive, arriving at 1:00 a.m., we checked into our room. Even though we are elite Marriott members, and have a standing request for a "high" floor room, our room was located closer to the bottom, with an excellent view of the parking garage. Normally this wouldn't have bothered us too much, except for the fact that it was our anniversary, so something from the hotel would have been nice, given that we stay at the Marriott's exclusively when we travel (which is several times a year). There wasn't even water in the water jug that was in the fridge. Having said this, we would stay at this location again, given the location. We do have to say that the bellhops and valet were all exceptional and some of the best that we've come across.

Reviews.Title: “Previous reviews were accurate--very nice hotel and stay”
Reviews.Author: Milbs_40
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Chicago this weekend for a short getaway over the Labor Day holiday. I read many of the previous reviews and feel like they give a very accurate depiction of the Residence Inn River North. First, the location is great. You are about 3 blocks north of the Chicago River on Dearborn and about 4 blocks west of Michigan Avenue. You are only about 2 blocks from the redline station on State and Grand. Tons of restaurants within walking distance. We had no problem getting anywhere we wanted. Safety/security was no concern. I felt totally comfortable walking around at all hours of the day and night. Will mention what others have said about being near a fire station--one block to the north. Yes, you can hear the sirens. Since we read the reviews, I requested a high floor and stayed on the 21st. Had no issues with noise from street bothering us. But the lower the floor, the higher the risk of you being bothered by street noise. Room was very spacious and comfortable. Had a decent kitchen setup--full fridge, microwave, dishwasher, sink and 2 burner oven. Nice look to the kitchen too with cabinetry and stainless appliances. room had a couch and full-sized chair in sitting area. Full wall was total glass with a nice city view. Commercial property directly across the road. Did have smaller building across as well that allowed for a full view to the NE. We could see all the way over to Marriott on Michigan Avenue along with several other highrise residential units. I thought the view was decent (we faced towards dearborn and looked North ). Bedding was good. Not the top of the line Marriott mattress though. But I had no problems. Shower was above average. total glass door and plenty of room. Only downside of bathroom area was only single vanity. The vanity was located next to bed in nook before entering bathroom/shower. Double vanity would have made for much more room for two trying to get ready. TV was situated next to window in middle of room. some may not like this setup. Normally the TV is placed in front of the bed. Can't do that in this room setup. But wasn't a big deal to me. i wasn't there to watch TV. TV channels were Direct TV Satellite. Ok selection with HBO too. Lobby entrance is on second level. Saw where some people complained about this. Dont really understand this. Yes, you have to go to two different sets of elevators to get to your room. I assume they do this for security reasons and logistics of property. Its not a big deal. I thought service was excellent. All of the workers that we encountered were pleasant and helpful. Service was not a problem. Complimentary breakfast was a madhouse. It was extremely busy and crowded. But...you are getting a free breakfast at a downtown hotel. Food selection was good--waffles, sausage, eggs, potatoes, bagels and donuts. If you don't want to mess with the crowd, go down the street and pay for breakfast--pretty simple. You do get free wireless internet at this property, too. In case you haven't read other posts, this property does share the building with a Springhill Suites. When you come up the street level elevator, the Springhill lobby is to the left and the Residence Inn is to the right. Residence Inn does have three computers downstairs that you can use as well. Just a couple of more points--does have workout room and pool on top floor. No room service or restaurant. Valet parking or self park. I think $48 and $38 per day. All in all, I was very happy with this property. It was exactly what I was expecting--maybe even a little bit better. Is this a 5-star hotel? No. Don't forget, this is a Residence Inn--a few notches down the Marriott food chain. But it is a very nice and clean property in a fantastic location. For the price, I think it is very difficult to beat in downtown Chicago. Read the reviews and make your own choice. Are you looking for luxury like a Michigan Avenue hotel? You will probably be disappointed. But I wasn't thinking this was going to be the Ritz Carleton or a Four Seasons. This is a top of the line Residence Inn with quality service, clean rooms and a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown Chicago hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: grensi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights using Marriott points. Hotel has everything you need. Three blocks from an El stop (State and Lake). Four blocks to Michigan Avenue. Good breakfast selections and even had a evening meal (hot dogs/salad). Rooms were comfortable with seperate bedroom and complete kitchen. Would definately stay in if downtown Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “HO”
Reviews.Author: bretts11
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at the Residence was with my wife, however, I had previously stayed here on business trips also. The staff is very friendly and helpful and I've never had any cleanliness issues. Dinners are provided by the hotel on weekdays and the breakfast is much better than standard hotel fare. The location of this hotel is hard to beat, it's just north of downtown Chicago and the Chicago River. Access to the El is within walking distance as well as Michigan Avenue. The fitness center and pool are located near the top floor, offering a fantasic view. There is a parking garage attached to the hotel that is only $38 per day, which is cheaper than a lot of other hotels in the area. Since the garage is attached, I wouldn't recommend valeting at this particlar hotel. In-and-out access if provided with the daily fee. The rooms are spacious, as is standard in Residence Inn's. Each room has a small kitchen and living room area. Internet is offered for free on several computers in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - near Magnificient Mile and Attractions”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveller4
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn on N. Dearborn is conveniently located about 4 blocks from N. Michigan Avenue (Magnificient Mile). Easy walk to many attractions (Millennium Park, Art Institute, Grant Park, Field Museum, etc) and to the downtown located south of the river. Also many restaurants to choose from in the area. We highly recommend Lou Malnati's Pizzeria on N. Wells Street (get there before 5:30 pm for dinner -- otherwise a long wait!). The Gage restaurant located across from Millennium Park is also highly recommended! We took the train from the airport (blue line, $2.25 fare) and walked about 4 blocks from the Clark/Lake station to the hotel. Faster than taking a taxi from the airport because traffic was heavy. We arrived on a Saturday around 4:30 pm. However, our room was not ready even though check-in was at 3:00 pm. We were told to take our luggage down from the 2nd floor lobby to the main floor hotel entrance for storage, and to return in an hour. We retrieved our luggage at 5:45 pm and went back up to the 2nd floor to check-in. But our room was still not available. When I asked to speak the manager, a room suddenly became available! Other than this problem, our stay was very pleasant. Free breakfast with a very good selection of hot and cold foods, and a very friendly staff in the dining area. Also free mini dinners (with free beer and wine) on Mondays to Thursdays. A good hotel for families travelling with children. Kitchen, laundry facilities, small swimming pool, fitness area, and free WiFi. Good value and convenient location!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable Accommodation at the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: grmacPickering
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience with this hotel. Rooms were clean and well maintained. Front desk staff was friendly and accommodating. The lady who managed seating and cleanup at breakfast was extremely friendly. The inn was in a good location for a tourist, i.e. within walking distance of all the major attractions. And the price was right. There were a lot of families at the hotel and when we went to the swimming pool, there were a lot of children in the water playing. People should keep this in mind, depending on their expectations. However, we never heard any children crying through the walls so it did not interfer with our positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKKF
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing, staff were extremely friendly, breakfast was great, even the social hour was good!

Reviews.Title: “Two Bedroom Suite in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PardonMeBoy
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a Chicago trip and require more than a hotel room, the RI Chicago Downtown River North is a great choice. This property has, I think, six (6) two-bedroom suites and ours was on the top floor, corner, with a slight view of the Chicago River. The location is steps from great restraurants, bars, pubs, drug stores, and coffe shops. Two blocks from the shopping mecca on the Mag Mile and three blocks from the CTA Loop and Blue Lines (State/Lake) or the Red Line (State). No need for a car in Chicago with the great CTA coverage. The bedrooms were at the ends of the suite with the living room/kitchen positioned in the middle. Bathrooms were off the bedrooms. Our suite was clean, comfortable, and in fine working order. The windows along the exterior walls are floor to ceiling and the view on the 26th floor was open to the city skyline and provided a colorful background at night. The staff was great and always helpful. The breakfast is included and to my surprise it included eggs, meats, potatos, and wafflels along with the usual contenental breakfast items. But plan to eat early before the sneezing, spilling, and screaming kids arrive to ruin your meal. Two bedroom suite would be the primary reason to stay here, location second, and being a Marriott is third.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience! Very friendly staff & clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JLfromMI
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law, two nieces and I had a fabulous stay at the Residence Inn on N Dearborn in Chicago (building is shared with SpringHill Suites)! The entire staff (front desk, housekeeping, bell desk, "Gatehouse" buffet... EVERYONE) was friendly - always greeted us with a smile and very willing to go out of their way to assist us. The rooms were clean and well maintained (hotel appears to be new), the breakfast buffet offered a HUGE variety of hot and cold items, and the evening cocktail hours and dinners exceeded expectations. Our room was pleasantly quiet - didn't hear hallway traffic or neighbors. I've traveled extensively for business - this is one of the best experiences I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: MamaDep
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very good value when you factor in the cost and convenience of breakfast. Great convenient location. 1.5 blocks from the River. 2 blocks to the red line. 3 blocks to the free trolley pick-up to Navy Pier. Walkable location to everywhere, although most hotels in Chicago are pretty convenient. Pros Free hot breakfast. Does not change much day-to-day but it's free and decent! Breakfast staff was awesome. They encourage you to bring some food back for snacks later in the day. Pool was not luxurious, but available nonetheless. As with any Residence Inn, the convenience of home...refrigerator, stove, dishes, etc. Free internet. Worked for us. Cons Limited area to park in front of hotel. Does not have a hotel driveway. You basically park on the street and unload. Not very safe when you have little ones. You really don't need a car in downtown Chicago...public transportation is safe and has multiple options. We took the blue line back to the airport to get a car rental on the second half of our trip to avoid the parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in River North”
Reviews.Author: anono99
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on several occasions, and I enjoy this hotel. I like that you can walk to shopping, theater, good restaurants, lively bars, HOB so depending on what you are in the mood for, it is nearby. The public transportation is only a couple of blocks away, and if you use the attached parking you get a bit of a discount (it is a bit expensive). The rooms are a really good size for downtown, and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MollyOrlando_Florida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the Marriott Residence Inn 6/28 - 7/1. The hotel is in a great location. We walked all over the city & saw so much. One of our main reasons for going was to take our 10 year old daughter to the American Girl store, this hotel is not far from there. The staff was very nice & helpful. The breakfast every morning was great. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: meluwood
Reviews.Content: I booked a corner suite and we were given a room on the 20th floor. I can't speak for other rooms, but ours was perfect. We had a great view of the city and the room was spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was great. They had a great variety to choose from. Being our first trip to Chicago, we wanted to eat out a lot but the last night, we had the free dinner. We were really suprised at all they had to offer. Almost wished we would have saved our money and ate there every night and just at lunch when we were out! Staff was really nice. The morning we were leaving, an employee helped us with all of our bags out of the hotel and helped us load all them in the cab. Before he knew the cab was out there, he offered to get us one ready. He was not a bellboy, just an employee working about getting on the elevator until he saw how many bags we had-he then offered to help us out. The ladies in the dining area were all really sweet too checking on us throughout our meals. I am so picky about cleanliness and I can honestly say, I could have eaten off the floors also, I wasn't afraid to get in the shower without my flip flops! We had some problems figuring out transportation around the city and sometimes wondered if we could have got a better location. However, the trade-off wouldn't have been worth it. We had a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a treat after being let down so badly.”
Reviews.Author: Happy1travel
Reviews.Content: Ten of us were travelling to Chicago for a family wedding. For five of the group it was their first visit to the USA and for all but one of us it was our first visit to Chicago. We had decided that we would really treat ourselves and booked a luxury 7 bed town house called Chateau Avalon through a rental company called Elite Chicago Rentals at elitechicagorentals.com We complied with all the terms of the rental, paid a hefty deposit and the full balance on the due date. Just days before we flew to the USA the woman at the property management company e-mailed by niece who had made the booking to say that the property "had been damaged" and we couldn't have it. My niece asked if she had any other properties of a similar size and was told "no." She asked if we could rent several smaller places to take us all, "no." Could she recommend any other property rental places - "no." Sooooooooooo helpful - NOT!. They even had the audacity to say it would take 7 to 10 days to refund the the thousands of dollars we had paid up front. it was paid back in two instalments and only after several e-mail enquiries. Would I use Elite Chicago Rentals again? Never in a million years!!!! Anyway, it was our lucky day as our niece managed to get 4 studio apartments in the Residence Inn in North Dearborn Street. The rooms are OK and are very well equipped and reasonably priced but what makes the place is the incredibly friendly and helpful staff. It was a pleasure to stay there. Close enough to walk into the city centre, a great steakhouse called Harry Carray's on the opposite corner and a great bar with live music called "Howl at the Moon" a few minutes walk in the opposite direction. Go there when they have the pianists and the rest of the band on - they're great. While you're there try a bucket of cocktails - yes, that's right, a bucket! Save yourself a bunch of heartache and stay at the Residence Inn rather than trying to rent a place off of Elite Chicago Rentals. You'll have a great stay. Loved Chicago by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Texas Birthday Girls Love the Residence and GM Jerry”
Reviews.Author: navysafe
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have been staying at the Residence Inn for 4 years in a row now celebrating our birthday with a girls weekend. We have been treated like Queens by the Residence staff from housekeeping all the way up to the General Manager, Jerry. We fly into O'Hare, hop on the train, walk a couple blocks and we at the hotel. Beyond perfect spot for shopping and dining. We look forward to coming back every year, and so pleased when the GM recognizes us year after year. The Managers reception was the big hit for us this past visit....we played Bingo, ate dinner, and had drinks....all complimentary of staying at the Residence Inn. Our room is immaculate with spectaular views of downtown Chicago. Thanks again Residence Inn....cant wait till next year to return. Joyce and Julie

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Momster66
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, plenty of room for everybody. Now that the kids are teenagers, renting a suite is a lot cheaper than two ordinary rooms. Nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with warmth and thoughtfulness”
Reviews.Author: travelers075
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Residence Inn, River North Downtown is fantastic!! We have nothing but praises to say about our stay there. Having a kitchen in our suite and breakfast ready for us every morning was wonderful. The kitchen helped tremendously with the kids because they were thirsty and hungry all the time. Also, I can't begin to tell you how wonderful it was having breakfast ready and waiting for us in the lobby area. It not only saved on time and trouble finding a place to eat but more so the convenience of it being right in your own hotel. Also, the selection of food was deliciously perfect. I will miss sharing the wonderful breakfast with my family every morning. The breakfast there left us with good memories. But even more I have to mention how the staff throughout the hotel was always so happy and cheerful to see us and help us with every little detail. We always received a cheery "good morning" and "hello" from everyone there. I never experienced so many happy people in one place at one time. Their cheerfulness helped us start and end our days with great happiness. Everything was very clean and well thought through. We would definitely stay again there in Chicago or in other states where they are located in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in Chcago!”
Reviews.Author: jgb722
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago with our two kids ( age 7 and 4) and whenever possible stay at extended stay properties like RI or Homewood Suites etc... We love the extra room and free breakfast/reception I booked the trip for a Mon-Thurs stay and got a rate of $179 including valet parking which in Chicago is pricey. The room type I reserved was a King suite. We arrived and instantly loved the property and the area. The staff greeted us warmly and I was impressed with the lobby area. Our room was ready and immaculate. The king suites have a full kitchen - so great for bringing drinks, snacks, heating or reheating things. The bedroom was separate from the sitting area and has it's own tv. (a must have with kids!). The bathroom was spacious and very clean. We went to breakfast every morning - wide array of food offered and well attended to. It was crowded but that's to be expected. The managers reception were great with full meals provided and free wine/beer/soda. We didn't eat there but took some food back to the room. The staff was amazing -- I did not encounter one person without a smile or who was not willing to help. We have stayed at another RI in Chicago and the Homewood Suites but this was the best hotel of the three and would definitely stay again. ($179 with parking/free breakfast AND dinner in Chicago - best deal I've found in a long time!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Stay”
Reviews.Author: mapsNH
Reviews.Content: Traveled with husband and 9 & 10 yr old kids for long Memorial Day weekend. It was to celebrate my 40th birthday and was suprised by the front desk staff with a bottle of wine--very nice! All staff members were extremely friendly and helpful. The location is ideal with many things within walking distance and an L station close by, too. The 1 BR suite was roomy but had a lot of boxy, ecclectic furniture that was non functional and took up space. Having to take an elevator up to the lobby got old but the staff was always waiting with friendly smiles and opened doors for us. Also, you needed your room key to go up in the hotel elevator which initially seemed like a great security feature but actually turned out to be a pain. We rented bikes for 2 days and were able to take them up to the room with us. Absolutley the best way to get around the city. Rented from Bobby's Bike Hike. The free wi-fi was very slow as were the computers in the lobby. Cell service was spotty too. The pool on the 27th floor had a great view but seemed small for the size of the hotel--it turned into kid soup over the weekend. Self serve laundry on this floor was convenient--$1 per wash/dry cycle. Breakfast in the morning was great and never had an issue with finding a place to sit. Overall a great stay and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: justbreathe2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Chicago for our honeymoon. I was reluctant to stay at a Residence Inn because it wasn't the "feel" I was looking for. I thought I wanted an eclectic place with the Downtown Chicago feel. I have to say, I'm happy I didn't get my way. The entire staff from the bellman to the Managers were always so happy to see us return after a day out. It really made us feel special and welcome. Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and helpful....I'd love to name them all, but it would take too long! I will say this, Ismeta, the hostess at the breakfasts every morning is an amazing woman!! I agree with the person who said, she does NOT get paid enough!! We tipped her and I recommend that if you stay here, you do the same! Another person who was of great help and very friendly is Mike P, a bellman at the hotel! The entire front desk staff was friendly and helpful with helping us get around town and finding places to eat! (Lou Malnati's was a great recommendation!) The only complaint I have is the fire station around the corner....lots of 2:30 AM calls, but like the other traveler said, inside the hotel was quiet. We had a smaller suite, as we booked through expedia, I didn't care for the bathroom being right next to the bed, but because of booking we weren't able to upgrade. Having the kitchen was great and I have to say I'll stay here again when we visit Chicago. We took cabs and public transit but were able to walk to so many different places. Navy Pier and Michigan Ave were well within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sdaj1993
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago for game 1 of the Stanley Cup Finals and stayed at the Residence Inn Downtown/River North. We stayed for 4 nights and it was a perfect spot. Breakfast (which is included) was hot and plentiful every morning. Staff was always friendly and helpful. Cleaning of the room was great. My only complaint (and this is not of the hotel) is the hotel is located around the corner from the fire hall and we did hear alot of sirens. However we did not hear any noise from within the hotel. Great restaurants and shopping all within walking distance. We only took a cab to the hockey game. Can't go wrong with this choice

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with Residence Inn River North for business travel”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityGuy
Reviews.Content: I guess if I was with my family, for the price and location, this hotel can't be beat. However, as a business traveler (and self-proclaimed hotel snob), I will be going elsewhere (back to the Hyatt/Westin/Renaissance). Now, I'm not a big Marriott fan to begin with (I think the rooms tend to be old and dated), but I stayed here because everything else was sold out, and my company has a special rate with Marriotts. A special rate that went from $200 per night for 2 nights, to $219 when I said I would be only staying one night. Not sure what that was about; check in clerk barely gave me eye contact until she handed me the key. Not very polite and seemed put out at every dealing I had with her. Manager's reception was poor...cold french fries and chicken fingers. I feel bad for the families who were using this for their dinner. Manager was very friendly and perky, but no one else cracked a smile, except one quick one from the "beer pourer" when I had a lot of foam in my beer that she poured from a pitcher. Are you getting the picture? Many restaurant choices throughout the nearby area. Room was generally clean, except the shower that had a huge dirt stain on the shower floor--caked into the plastic. I'd rather pay for my internet, beer, hors' d ourvers, and stay in an inconvenient place than come back here...horribly disappointed, especially after all the great comments. Think twice before staying here, especially if you are a frequent business traveler (so much for my eliteness at Marriott--means nothing here-thought I would at least get a clean shower).

Reviews.Title: “A great deal - even better than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: pixie5008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location (easy to get to from the 'el') and right in the middle of lots of restaurants, bars, and hotels. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. People that were staying for longer periods of time seemed to actually know the staff on a first-name basis. The gym facilities were very nice, the room itself was very clean and comfortable, and the food provided was more than decent. There was even a complimentary "social hour" with food, beer, and wine. Probably a feature of all residence inns, my room had a full kitchen (including dishes, cooking utensils and dish soap). Overall, this place was cheaper than anything else I looked at in the area, and was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott perfected "How to Treat Your Guest" with this location.”
Reviews.Author: Bthomas314
Reviews.Content: My family had construction work done on our home and we stayed at this location 16 days in March-April 2010 (we live in Chicago). Although the circumstances were difficult, the hotel made our stay enjoyable. The hotel staff-- absolutely everyone-- always had a smile and a hello. Every positive comment made on this site about this hotel is appropriate. One evening, my wife made a very positive comment to the front desk about Ismeta the breakfast hostess/waitress and the staff told her to look at TripAdvisor where she is a mini-star. Her status on this site is certainly well deserved. Many times Ismeta helped my wife with getting breakfast together for her and our 16 month old son. On days help wasn't necessary-- she always had several good words and smiles and the offer to help was always right there. Whatever they pay her is not enough (sorry Marriott). And although Ismeta is the staff "star" the rest of the staff is not far behind. They were not only courteous but friendly, almost like family-- and not in an overly-gracious sort of way. They were really pitch perfect. Another special thank you to Billy at the front desk-- who consistently helped with our stay. Complementary breakfast is provided seven days a week. Four nights a week they have "happy hour" complementary dinner with wine and beer (also complementary) served. Granted, there are several great restaurants literally within a three block radius, but, for a free bite and beer, you can' t beat it. Cleanliness: I also could not make a complaint about cleanliness. The hotel was clean throughout. Location: five stars on location. I can count five world-class restaurants within five blocks, not including three Rick Bayless restaurants on the next block. Great steak places; a couple nice club/bars within one block, plus a dueling pianos place which is a lot of fun as well. A great wine place (Bin 36) on the next block. These are the places off the top of my head; there are a slew of others also nearby. Plus, the hotel is right across the river from the business district. Rate: was also great, especially for the amount of space (a lot of space) provided. And our room's view was beautiful. To me, the bedding was not great, but, this is subjective as my wife would disagree. Its not a five start hotel-- you're not staying at the Four Seasons at this property. But, it is a great stay at a great price. The great thing was, the staff's enthusiasm was infectious. Most of the hotel guests had smiles and friendly comments for one another. It was like staying at a big bed and breakfast. The place is great for business travel because you can walk to the office and breakfast and dinner is served by a great staff. I can't imagine how you could beat this place for business travel. And for the extra space provided, I can't see how you could beat this for a trip for a family with children. Great stay. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our honeymoon awesome!”
Reviews.Author: BaylorDrana
Reviews.Content: This was a belated honeymoon for us, and it was our first time traveling together for no other motive but just a good time (no graduation, wedding, etc.). The hotel staff was SO kind and very accommodating. They even gave us the option of changing our reserved room to one that cost the same but had a much better view! The free breakfast was extensive and very impressive, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. At first I was hesitant to reserve at the River North location as I'd heard so many good things about the Magnificent Mile. Pfft. River North is a terrific area as well!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Stay at Residence Inn!!!”
Reviews.Author: ssolde1
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Chicago for his birthday. I chose Residence Inn because of the reviews on tripadvisor, the location and of course the price! We definitely were not disappointed. The rooms were spacious, the breakfast was amazing, there were several restaurants and bars within walking distance and the staff was very helpful. We were provided with information on restaurants, bars and sight-seeing activities from the front desk. We even ordered pizza and had it delivered using one of the computers in the lobby (free internet) after a night out (we ordered online because the front desk informed us that we would get a discount). We had an unbelievable time in Chicago and couldn't have asked for a better place than Residence Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service. Extremely Friendly and Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: CinciSam
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with our 6 and 4 year old boys...a 4 day Spring Break trip to the museums, etc. The staff was one of the friendliest and most helpful I have encountered (15 years experience of business travel, etc.). I have been fortunate to stay at some posh properties (Penisula, Ritz, etc.), but this Hotel is on par in terms of service. In particular the doorman and their insights, the front desk and their patience with my boys questions (ex. "are the alligators real at Rain Forest Cafe?"), and the breakfast staff featuring Ismeta. She was fantastic, genuine and was always one-step ahead of us (bringing the boys waffles, etc.). She even packed a few treats as she knew we were departing. Since we are only 4 hours away, we will retrun to Chicago again...and will definetly look here first to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2010”
Reviews.Author: ScrappingMomof3
Reviews.Content: My sister and I and our 5 kids decided to spend the night in the city for our spring break adventure. I chose this hotel because I was able to get my employee rate for this particular weekend. I ended up getting 2 king bed studio suites. We were able to get them next to eachother at the end of a hallway, so we felt safe going in and out of the rooms. The rooms were nice enough. Clean and were very comfortable. The kitchen was clean and very modern. We were able to check in early and get settled. The front desk was very friendly, but forgot to explain to me that I needed my key to work the elevator to get to our room as well as to get back down to the lobby. No big deal, my kids figured it out for me! We tried to go swimming later that afternoon, but some kid decided to poop in the pool, so they had to close it for 4 hours. Although it's hard to get upset in a situation like that, some guy gave the poor maint guy a hard time. Oh well, can't control everything. The breakfast Sunday morning was a little busy, but they did good keeping the food coming and cleaning off the tables. They probably could have used another couple waffle makers, but everyone was patient and all was ok. The parking was very convenient and I felt safe going from the garage directly into the hotel. All in all, the hotel was very nice and met my expectations and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, perfect location, delightful staff!”
Reviews.Author: monaboots
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect! The location is super convenient, smack in the middle of downtown so you could walk just about everywhere. Every single staff member we came across was polite and greeted us with a smile. The lobby/lounge area is very trendy well decorated. There are some chairs and a couple of televisions if you just want to hang out. There is also a business center with 2 computers on the lobby level where you can get on the internet and print anything if you need to and it is complimentary. We did not use the pool or gym, but they do have them on the 27th floor. One night around 10pm our toilet wouldn't flush and the front desk sent someone up right away. The service man was very nice and fixed it within minutes. We didn't have any more trouble with it the rest of the trip. The breakfast is great. Waffles, yogurt, bagels, eggs, sausage, you name it and it is free! The breakfast attendant Ismeta is super nice! She greets you with a big smile and makes you feel right at home. The beds were so comfortable and there is a thermostat in each room so you could control the temperature. Bit of advice, we got a really good military discount on our room. If you are in the military, be sure to check the military rate AND the AAA rate to see which one might be cheaper. I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chach
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Residence Inn on Walnut, I decided to give this one a try since a) it's in the River North and b) it has a pool. Since the hotel is newer, it's very clean and modern. There a lots of nice, open areas to lounge near the lobby. The room was a standard Res Inn: great kitchen, bath area, cozy beds etc... The breakfast is standard. It does get VERY crowded. But the staff is super friendly and busses tables quickly. I used to live a few blocks away and really enjoy the River North. There are so many great restaurants nearby in different price ranges. It's also near the Red Line and not too far from the others in the loop. It's really easy to catch a cab outside or grab the bus. If you're into chain store shopping, it's good to stay in the River North since Mich Ave is nearby. You're also not far from State/Madison.

Reviews.Title: “So here's the skinny...”
Reviews.Author: segs77
Reviews.Content: Getting to the lobby requires an elevator ride, and getting to your room is another ride, but once you are there this is a nice place. Unlike a lot of Residence Inns, this one has a hotel feel to it, including a large lobby and a decent breakfast. The workout center was a little larger than most, and well equipped. On the downside, the elevator rides get pretty old, and if you call ahead to get your car out of valet you will be disappointed by the wait. Despite what the guy at the desk tells you, they wait until you are in the lobby before fetching your car from (I would guess) southern Wisconsin. The rooms are spartan but clean, and the views are pretty cool depending on how high you are. Flat panel TVs, a decent bed and sitting area and a kitchen with pots, pans, etc... Overall, I would not hesitate to stay there again, and It's even nice enough for my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, couple small issues”
Reviews.Author: kdets89
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at Residence Inns because we like the convenience of a kitchen, and the fact that they have great breakfasts. Those items did not disappoint in this stay. The location is great, within easy walking distance of great restaurants and shopping. Vallet parking is pricey, but so easy. The fitness center was nice and the guest laundry convenient. The minor issues we had included a broken closet door, and the fact that the tv included only basic cable channels with just one movie station. Being February, being able to chose and enjoy a movie in our warm room would have been nice. Otherwise, everything was clean and everyone was friendly, as we have come to expect from Residence Inns.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience for price you pay”
Reviews.Author: austex31
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based largely on the overwhelmingly positive reviews on TripAdvisor. I think that maybe my expectations were a little too high. Don't get me wrong: we had a positive experience and paid a great weekend rate. However, i was not overwhelmed by the experience. We found it to be typical of any other Residence Inn. The location is great. The staff was friendly at front desk. Staff was almost non-existent in the breakfast buffet. Again, positive experience but not memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great suites, great staff”
Reviews.Author: CrispyOne
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a two bedroom suite and had lots of room for everyone to have space without getting into each other's way. Easy to walk to Water Tower Place and Navy Pier, easy to get taxis to the museums, and easy to cook dinner in the room if kids were too cranky after a long day to behave themselves in a restaurant. More than anything, the staff were awesome, especially at breakfast. Would definitely stay here again. (In fact, thought of writing this overdue review when looking at making reservations for next month.)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mks5
Reviews.Content: My experience was one of the best I've had. People on staff, from maintenance, to front desk people to Estma (? sp.) at the morning breakfast - everyone was genuinely friendly and helpful. By day three, she knew my name and that I liked my juice mixed, 1/2 oj, 1/2 apple juice!! She greeted me every morning. I thought being on the 12th floor would be a pain everyday to go up and down, especially back & forth to business center, but the elevators were very fast and there was never a delay. The valet parking people were friendly, professional and on time bringing the car when I had to leave and come back. The morning breakfast and evening Manager's socials were among the best I have experienced. The suite I was in was beautifully decorated and very clean, w/ fullsize refrigerator, dishwasher, stove (no oven), and microwave. There were dishes, silverware, glasses, wine glasses, a few pots/pans, plus other kitchen gadgets. If I had to pick something negative, it was the need for another computer at the business center, (for the size of the hotel), and a lack of supplies (stapler, paper clips, envelopes). Although the printer says it is also a fax machine, it was not working, but the front desk happily faxed a couple of things for me. It is located in a great area of the downtown and was convenient to the places I had to go to in Chicago for business. There is a Jewel Grocery store a couple blocks away, if you need to buy groceries.

Reviews.Title: “I usually like Residence Inns. Not very happy with this one.”
Reviews.Author: SailorJon11
Reviews.Content: I selected this place based on reviews at TripAdvisor.com and after staying several times at Residence Inns with satisfactory results. I was not happy with this one. At checkin, they put a $100 "hold" on my bank account for "incidentals." I have no idea what that is, and they couldn't explain it when I asked about it. After I checked out with a zero balance due, the $100 "hold" remained on my bank account for several days thereafter. I called the hotel about this, and even though they agreed that I had a zero balance and didn't owe them anything, they could not remove the $100 "hold" from my bank account. They said that it should "fall off" of my account's pending transactions after a few days, and indeed that happened a few days after I called, but I should not have been charged for this in the first place. And what "incidentals" are they talking about, anyway? This place has no room service and has no stocked refrigerator. So there is no good reason that I can discern for the $100 "hold." By the way, I was not informed that this $100 "hold" would be imposed when I booked the hotel. Now to the room. The "blackout" curtains in our 16th floor room were insufficient to block out the lights from the adjoining properties. There was no operating vent or window in the bathroom (vent exists but since it was not connected to any switch it could not be turned on). There was only one bedside nightstand rather than one on each side of the bed. The bed just barely fit into the space: there was less than two feet of walkable clearance between the wall and the foot of the bed. Another weird thing: this property is a Residence Inn/Springhill Suites, but it wasn't like most Residence Inns. I have stayed in Residence Inns many times but this is not what I have come to expect. There was no silverware or dishwasher, no dishware, no kitchen, no kitchen sink, no full size refrigerator (only a college dorm type small refrigerator) and there is no freezer at all. No ice or vending machines available on any floor (you have to go down to the "convenience" store near the front desk, and they ran out of ice even there). The breakfast was not very good and the breakfast facility was far too small for the number of hotel guests who were trying to use it. Perhaps my problems were attributable to the fact that I was shuffled over to the "Springhill Suites" part of this property, but when they lead you to believe that you're booking and staying in a Residence Inn, I don't think that you should be given the bait and switch to a Springhill Suites. I never heard of Springhill Suites before, but it's no Residence Inn, that's for sure. The parking was very expensive. I left my car at home, and that would have been fine but for the fact that the nearby Grand and State subway station (CTA Red Line) is under construction currently and the escalator was out of service due to the construction. That was a problem with all of the luggage, etc. I will say one good thing about this property: it was very quiet and it's in a good location. Finally, this place is not well suited for couples looking for a getaway. Sorry to have to disagree with all of the good reviews here, but my experience there was not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Will Definately Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Jess_in_Ks
Reviews.Content: I was completely satisfied with this hotel. My room was amazing, I loved the kitchen area complete with a fridge, microwave, stove, and dishwasher. Everything was spotless clean and I loved the huge bathroom. The location was quite nice (only a ten minute walk from the heart of downtown) and Harry Carey's and House of Blues was across the street. Staff was kind and helpful. Free breakfast, evening appetizers, and evening drinks were excellent bonuses. I WILL be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Hotel in the Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: FsuTraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for this hotel and got a great online rate. Since the rate was so low I did not expect much from this hotel and was worried because I turned down a popular (but expensive) 4 star hotel to stay here...I was completely wrong. First off this is a brand new hotel which means new sheets,furniture,kitchen,bathroom,lobby etc. The rooms were extremely clean, spacious, and impressive. I went during the middle of the week so not only did I receive a free hot breakfeast buffet in the morning, but a free dinner buffet at night,and to be honest the selection and food was excellent. The hotel also had free wifi in lobby and room, and also a free business center in case you forgot your laptop. They have an exercise room, pool and hot tub on the top floor overlooking the city (perfect after a long day). The one aspect of the hotel that stood out the most was the amazing service and friendliness of the employees. Each morning I was greeted, when I came back they welcomed me,when I needed help they knew exactly where everything was, when I needed extra towels and sheets it came to the door in less than 2 minutes!! This hotel makes most marriot hotels I stayed in seem like 2 star hotels.Each hotel I stay in I can find at lest one con (even if it is minor) but this hotel was 100% perfect! I will only stay at this hotel in Chicago, even if the rate is double of what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, value and location served by a friendly and courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: Picksixty
Reviews.Content: Our son's entry into the Chicago Marathon presented the opportunity for a short visit to Chicago. A four day reservation was arranged cheerfully and without difficulty. Our arrival through O'Hare International two days prior to the marathon gave adequate time to settle-in and to gain a perspective on hotel facilities and navigation around the city. Catching the train from O'Hare delivered us within three blocks from our hotel. The hotel proved to be an ideal location as a launch pad for touring the city and for short foot-bound excursions to many nearby attractions. The hotel is within blocks of ground transportation and was a short distance to many critical waypoints along the marathon route. When coming "home" to the hotel we always received a friendly and courteous greeting from the hotel staff. Room service was equally cordial and helpful. The rooms were spacious and sparkling clean. The hotel's breakfast buffets were great as were the extended facilities. We would recommend this hotel to family and friends and will return at our earliest convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, great location, great service !”
Reviews.Author: DiegoMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Arrived from Minneapolis on Thu Oct 15 and left on Sun Oct 18. We were able to have the "social hour" dinner on Thursday (only served M-TH 1800-1930). Nothing special, self serve buffet style, salad, Grille chck breast sandwich, brown beans, chips and brownies. All served with pop, water, wine or beer. It was nice to save some money on not going out to eat and after the trip and some sightseeing we were ready for an early dinner and time at the indoor pool (27th floor). Our kids (6 and 8) loved the pool and hot tub. Not too crowded and with great views. The included breakfast was also great: make your own waffles, sausage, potatoes, eggs, cereal, fruit, coffee, juices, yogurt, etc The service from the hotel staff was 5 stars. Everyone really does his/her best to make your stay enjoyable. Upon checking, we were given a bottle of wine and some chips when during the conversation came up the fact that it was our weeding anniversary that weekend! Nice gesture. The location could not be better. Close to the CTA system. We rode cabs as for 4 people most rides were only $10.00. CTA buying single passes it would have been $7.00, so no brainer. The room was spacious. I was worried about some comments I heard about not having space with the pull out sofa out, but there is still a good 3 feet of space between the bed and the pull out bed. It was not an issue for us. It was great having the microwave (there is free mwave popcorn provided, next to the coffee packets), the full fridge is sooo convenient (we brought a cooler full of snacks). Full dishwasher, sink, silverware and dinnerware for four, and a 2 burner stove (no oven). We had lots of room to stretch out, the furniture was confy, we never felt crowded.
