We stayed on the 24th floor and city noise was not an issue other than the occasional siren from an emergency vehicle or the occasional honk. Never heard anything at night. Very happy with the room, service, location and price. Parking at $45.00/night is std. price for Chi Hotel. 1 block West there is a self park at 1/2 the price which is what I did. Free wi-fi everywhere, lobby, room, dining area, etc Our rate was $139.00/night during this stay. I will try hard to get this hotel again next time we are in Chicago. For families, because the extra space and all else mentioned above, it is a no brainer. Hope this helps the next person researching this great hotel. Diego

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the price in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: EbonieBarnes
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Chicago and stayed the first night in Hilton Garden Inn and was not impressed at all. The next day we went to Residence Inn and it was the total opposite experience. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. Even though they were extremly busy they worked fast and efficiently to get everyone to their rooms. The room was spotless and everything was just so cozy and comfortable. The kitchenette is so great to have because Chicago has some great places to eat and you can bring your food back to store and reheat it. The bed was comfortable and the chaise lounge was even better to just kick your feet upon. I would recommend this hotel for the staff, price, location and cleanliness anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: MumandSonDublin
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in great location for both shopping, lake walking and viewing architecture. We loved having the kitchen facilities and would plan to use them more in the future particularly as a useful supermarket was just beside the hotel and it gives you a good excuse to go to Charlie Trotters to Go ! Staff were great, friendly and helpful and the breakfast, although simple, was just what we needed to get our day off to a good start. This was our first stay in a Suite hotel and we plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great rooms and breakfast to boot!”
Reviews.Author: vaiomom
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of rooms for the price we paid. The suite was amazing, we upgraded to a corner suite for $10 more at check-in. My children were absolutely fascinated by the view, and the floor to ceiling windows, so we spent a large portion of our time in the room with the curtains open so they could look out. The staff were very friendly, especially the folks at the breakfast buffet.. The manager came around with little prizes for the kids and we were treated as if we paid a lot more for the room! Breakfast was a treat, waffles, and all the fixin's and then the complimentary dinner in the lobby was a very nice touch as well. We used the pool and although it was a bit small, it was perfect for a bit of relaxing. The hotel is within walking distance of some very nice resturants and millenium park (and also some not-so-nice places, but it's a big city, that's to be expected!). The next time we head to Chicago, this will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amazing Service.”
Reviews.Author: Dave G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in for a weekend with our two sons. Laura at the front desk had put us on the same floor as our friends. Throughout the weekend, she greeted me by name and remembered my room number even though the hotel was busy. We were extremely impressed. The breakfast area was well run as well. The attendant, whose name escapes me, but who was originally from Bosnia, was extreme friendly and thoughtful. It was a great experience at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HeliMom
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, helpful staff. The woman helping with the Saturday breakfast buffet was phenomenal - extremely busy but she personally thanked everyone she met for "staying at our Residence Inn". She worked harder than any waitress I've seen, yet probably rarely gets tips. We tipped her - I hope others will remember to do this too, those folks certainly deserve it. Do NOT get this hotel with PriceLine. They quoted one rate on the internet and when we called them 2 minutes later, they jacked that rate up by $40.00. Do not use them! Valet parking expensive.

Reviews.Title: “pefect hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: mjohnsonLittleRock
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights in mid-august. The hotel stay was excellent. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location cannot be beat. I didn't think the kitchenette would be very useful but really enjoyed the convenience of a refrigerator and small kitchen in the suite. I've stayed in about 10 hotels in the downtown chicago area over the last few years and this was by far the best (especially considering the reasonable rates).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location, all you need.”
Reviews.Author: Ducati40
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Big rooms, We had two different ones, One "normal room" but this was huge too, see photos. Kitchen corner with all you needed if you want to make some food and dishwasher too. Sleeping sofa and sitting area, but very close to the bed so no room for privacy! Also booked a junior suite - came with king bed and a sleeping sofa in the other room. Door between them. Had a full size kitchen with sitting area. Great when traveling with teenagers. TV in both rooms. Lots of towels and every thing was very clean, new and fresh. Maid service was good, did all the kitchen work :-) Breakfast was good, tend to be a bit crowded towards the end of serving time. Good idea to arrive in time! We liked the hot oatmeal with cranberries, almonds.... healthy and nice! You could also have eggs, potatoes, waffle, - all the normal stuff. The Breakfast maid, Ismeta was a daily joy, always smiling, helping and looked after everything. She managed to made every problem disappear and helped everyone. Generally that was our impression of all the staff, very attentive, smiling and willing to help. Gym was nice, good size. Pool also, with a great view! Easy walking to the magnificent mile, to downtown - sort of in between what you want to see. Several restaurants around the corners. Don't miss Rock Bottom, a brewery with good food and lots of local beers. Cabs are easy and cheap and will save your feet from some long distance walking! About $ 22 to the science and industry museum, which is far away but a great museum! Zoo is free and good. Our favorite was the Millennium Park, lots of fun there and totally free! If we goo back we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel---the rooms, location, and experience were great.”
Reviews.Author: CAGIRL401
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn Chicago Downtown/River North for 3 nights. I was very happy with the size, layout, and quietness of our room. We were on the 19th floor and had a beautiful city view out our window. The location was perfect as shopping on Magnificient Mile was a few blocks away and restaurants were plentiful within walking distance. Public transportation was a short walk across the river from the hotel and we easily made it to the museums without much extra walking required. The employees were all helpful and provided tips on dining available and directions. My only negative comment would be on the cost of parking $44 per day, but this is Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: mdpooh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn, Chicago Downtown, River North, while my husband attended a conference. The hotel is very conveniently located to all public transportation and there are many restaurants within walking distance. The room was spacious, immaculate, with all amenities. All rooms are suites, with a large sleeper couch, arm chair, full kitchen. The full kitchen was a surprise. It had full-sized refrigerator, 2 burner countertop stove, microwave, all utensils. A full, hot breakfast is served daily as well a dinner Monday-Thursday. We expected a few hors d'oeuvres but one night had lasagna, salad, bread, wine or beer, dessert. The next night was chicken Caesar salad with all the other mentioned items. Having both breakfast and dinner would certainly save a family a lot of money! The hotel has an exercise room and indoor pool on the top floor, free access to internet in the lounge/dining area, a very comfortable lobby and helpful staff. It shares an entranceway with Springhill Suites, another Marriott property. I don't think the guests at Springhill have the manager's dinner included in their stay. I would definitely stay at the Residence Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: sidney14
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn was a nice surprise. After checking in with the General Manager, I realized that if he was running the hotel, it was going to be a great stay. The room was exceptionally clean, spacious, and nicely decorated. The breakfast in the morning was yummy and contained a lot of choices. Finally, the location of the Residence Inn can't be beat. Great restaurants, shops, bars, all within walking distance. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Nicer than my house!”
Reviews.Author: MissingSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 night here and I did not want to leave! Everything was great--the staff was so helpful and friendly, the room was beautiful and clean, the pool was refreshing (but a little too crowded with wild children), the breakfast and the manager's reception in the evening let us just buy lunch out which really helped the wallet! The general manager Jerry is so nice and his staff follows his lead with warmth and hospitality! Jerry was there in the early mornings cleaning tables so people could sit and he was there in the evenings greeting people and pouring beverages--this man loves this hotel and it truly shows! I would highly recommend a stay here and will certainly stay again on our next Chicago trip! Only complaint would be the pillows are too soft but we all slept great anyways!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: escape_the_cold
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights during a business trip to Chicago. Excellent customer service...all staff we encountered were very friendly and accomodating, from the doormen to the front desk to housekeeping. The one bedroom suite was modernly furnished with couch/chair, desk and dining table. Kitchenette was fully stocked with clean dishes and utensils. Plenty of space for 2 people to spread out and be comfortable. Room was very clean and quiet (other than random "city" noises, sirens, etc). Breakfast was great and included scrambled eggs, waffles, cereal, fruit, etc. There is a CVS about a block away if you want to stock up on snacks, bottled water, wine, etc. Lots of good restaurants nearby also. Great location, within walking distance of Millenium Park, Michigan Avenue and Navy Pier. Didn't need our car during the entire stay, just walked or took taxis. Valet parking was $44 a day. Will stay here again during next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: CruisnAddict
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate ($119 per night) on Marriott.com. Great location was in walking distance to a number of good restaurants (Gino's East, Portillo's, Al's #1 Italian Beef, etc.). Free Navy Pier trolley picks up 2 blocks away and a CTA bus stop is right across the street. About 6 blocks from the nearest EL train station (to get to either airport). Room was clean (and maintained clean throughout our stay). The fold-out sofa is directly across from the bed. It would've been nice if it had been behind a partition or somehow a little more out of sight. King size bed was comfortable, felt fresh every night. Full-size kitchen with full fridge, sink, microwave and dishwasher. View from the room was great. And it was not noisy at all (like I've heard some other hotels can be). Of course, we were on the top floor so that may explain it. Service was OUTSTANDING...we arrived shortly before 10:00 AM and expected to have to check our luggage so we could sight-see before checking in. However, they let us check in 5 hours early! I also asked for a high room and got the highest they have (26th floor). Multiple door men on the sidewalk always speaking and friendly. Front desk crew very courteous. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kidmozart
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights with our 2 1/2 month old and it was great. Our room had plenty of space to spread out in, great furniture and lighting, and free wired and wireless internet. Everything was very clean and it was great to have a kitchen to use for dinners. The staff was so friendly and helpful and the hot breakfast (eggs, sausage, potatoes, oatmeal plus all the normal continental stuff) was a nice perk. The pool is on the 27th floor and has great views over the city, they also have a nice exercise room up there and a laundry facility. The only thing I would warn about is that it's about a 10-15 minute walk to get to Michigan Ave, which for us with a baby made it difficult to get out and shop a lot. Overall a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service!”
Reviews.Author: jmf3
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent two nights at the Residence Inn with some friends of ours. This was a GREAT hotel! We booked it for $119/night which seemed like a steal! It was centrally located and we walked all over the city. From the moment we pulled up, the service was impeccable from the valet station to the bellhops to the check-in desk. Everyone was friendly and helpful. There is a small lobby at street level and you take an elevator to the first level to check in. From there, you access a different bank of elevators to go to your room and you need your keycard to use the elevator. I liked this added level of security as my daughter and one of the friends we were with are only 17 years old. We stayed in a studio suite which, I believe, is the smallest room they offer. There was a wall of floor to ceiling windows which made the room seem very light and much bigger than it probably was. It also had a flat screen TV. There was a small but very nice kitchenette which included a microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator and two burner cooktop. There was a king size bed as well as a pullout couch. I spent a night on each bed and both were comfortable. Even with four of us in the room, we felt that it was spacious. The bathroom sink was outside of the toilet and shower area which was very convenient while traveling with two teenage girls! There was no bathtub but a large walk-in shower which we really liked. Free WiFi is also provided which we always like to have. The lounge and breakfast area are on the same level as the front desk. There were four computer/printer stations available for guest use at no charge which came in handy for printing some tickets we had purchased online. There is also a large flat screen TV and comfortable couches and chairs. This came in handy when my friend and I were ready to sleep but our daughters wanted to stay up talking. They just went down to the lounge and we felt that they would be very safe there. The buffet breakfast included a lot of hot items and was delicious. The dining area had plenty of tables with wonderful views of the streets below. Also, if you stay on any Monday through Thursday night, there is a free, light dinner meal provided in the lounge. We didn't take advantage of it but thought that was pretty generous! There is a pool and fitness area on the top floor. I didn't see it but my daughter checked it out and said it was very nice. I asked a lot of questions at the front desk about things we were planning to do. Not only did they answer my questions patiently but also made additional suggestions. I also utilized the valet parking. It was $44 for each 24 hours which, for Chicago, is pretty typical. I checked the car in and out several times and the service was quick and efficient. I travel to Chicago frequently and have stayed at a number of hotels. I HIGHLY recommend this one to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at this very nice Residence Inn!!! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: meins57
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this Residence Inn. Staff was WONDERFUL. From housekeeping who went out of there way to provide us with something they did not have in stock, to the front desk who offered some free candy to my tired young traveling children (traveled from CA with young children), to the hotel manager, Jerry Keyes, who greeted us kindly during one of the free happy hour meals and asked us how our room was. I was impressed because he was right there helping his staff and very cordial to his guests. The room was excellent (room 2005), decorated nicely and very clean. The kids enjoyed the indoor pool on the top floor. The location is outstanding (close to Navy Pier, shopping- if you like to walk- you could definitely walk to Art Institute- we did it with our three kids). Harry Cary's across the street- yummy food. LOTS of food choices. We had a nice time and felt very comfortable here. This experience causes me to lean towards Marriott when I plan travel for my family. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geneseoguy
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love this hotel when staying in Chicago. It has a great location near Michigan Avenue and surrounded by a mix of restaurants. The staff is very helpful, and always friendly. Hotel is clean and modern. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,value, and customer service”
Reviews.Author: Suska13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for families with babies- the dishwasher and large room was a lifesaver! The customer service of the staff was 5 star- incredibly friendly! The rooms were updated and modern and very clean. The housekeeper kept everything clean and stocked and even folded our clothes and lined up our shoes. The location was great- every restaurant and just a few blocks to State Street shopping and also Michigan Ave. Also right next to the river. Millenium Park was also an easy walk. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great staff - great location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuySeattle
Reviews.Content: My wife, 8-year old daughter and I stayed for 5 nights during Spring Break. Unfortunately, "Spring" in Chicago means everything from snow to freezing rain to beautiful, sunny days, each of which we experienced during our stay! The hotel is very conveniently located just a 5-10 minute walk from just about anywhere you'd like to go - shopping, entertainment restaurants, etc.. Close to bus lines "El" lines for destinations further away. We were quite happy with out room - high floor with a King size bed and sofa bed for our daughter. We didn't hear much noise from the streets below, or the fire station at the corner. The kitchen with full size fridge came in handy for storing drinks, snacks etc.. Of course Spring Break was a busy time for this property, with a lot of families staying in the hotel. Kids everywhere (including ours!). The morning breakfast was extremely busy, and the hotel's management team was there each day, clearing tables and pouring coffee, giving the buffet staff more time to keep the food refilled. Same for the evening receptions. It was nice to come back in after a long day out in the cold and enjoy a bowl of hot soup and a sandwich! We took a shuttle van to / from the airport, so didn't need to use the hotel's expensive parking. Walked ot took a bus everywhere we went. With it's great location and good value, we'll stay again on our next trip to the Windy City!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Just a few odd Kinks”
Reviews.Author: rclib
Reviews.Content: Me and my family enjoyed this hotel a lot. The breakfast was wonderful and the evening reception was to great to pass up. Our room was on a high floor, which we prefer, and was very comfortable. There where only a few things that left me with a sour taste in my mouth. As i ordered a beer in the evening i noticed my name was on a list, with every other guest in the hotel. I felt this truly compromised privacy of all the guest staying here. Also, While my nieces where traveling on the elevator it broke and they where stuck on it for 15 minutes. No one stayed on the emergency phone with them nor was the hotel even notified that there guest where stuck on the elevator. I found out about this event from them. It just amazed me that no one in the hotel would contact me over this. They did comp 50$ of our over all stay,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynndy2006
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 studio suites for 3 days. We were able to check in early but was disappointed that one of our 2 rooms was extremely small compared to the other one. It was so small that we would not have any room to walk around the room if we put the sofabed out. The larger room was almost double the size. I couldnt understand why we were paying the same rate for such different sized rooms. I went to the desk to ask for a larger room and was told there were none available near my first room and no other 2 large rooms together available in the hotel, hard to believe since there is 27 floors. After much complaining from me, they said they would try to upgrade me to a 1 bedroom suite but then said they could not since I booked through a 3rd party. Then they did offer me another room but it was at the opposite end of the hotel which was unacceptable to me. I continued to complain and also mentioned that I would be writing the corporate office to let them know how dissatisfied I was and they finally did upgrade me to a 1 bedroom suite right across the hall from our other room. Both of the rooms we had were very nice and clean. Only disappointment was that I found dirty socks underneath the couch cushion when putting the sofa bed out which lead me to believe they did not change mattress pads between guests. The rest of the hotel was also very clean and new looking. There was a very large lobby with comfortable seating, TV, computers, etc. The free breakfast was exceptional with large selection including make your own waffles. The lady that was working in the dining area each morning was very friendly and helpful, she even offered to make waffles for guest, got refills on drinks and made sure everyone was well taken care of. The free dinners (Monday to Thursday) were a pleasant surprise. We had soup and sandwiches the first night, Lasagna, salad, garlic bread the second night, and hot dogs and brats the last night. There was also free soft drinks, wine, beer, and snacks. Have never been to a hotel that served such wonderful free meals. Saved us alot of money. The management staff was very visable during the meals and stopped at every table to ask if everything was ok. It was also very impressive that they even helped clean up tables. Pool was on the 27th floor with gorgeous view. Was a little small for size of hotel. The location of hotel was very good, only about 5 minutes from Union Station, short walk to free trolley to Navy Pier and also bus stops. The hotel provided a nice city map that included excellent directions from hotel to various attractions either by walking, taxi, bus, etc. Was told at check in we would need to use room key to get off elevator (assuming this was for security reasons) but this was not true entire stay. Upon departing the hotel for the train station, we asked one of the men at the door if there was a van that would accomodate all 5 of us. He told us to wait and then proceeded to run up the street. We lost sight of him for a few minutes but then he showed up riding in the taxi van he had found for us. I was amazed that he went to such extreme measure to accomodate us. What wonderful service!

Reviews.Title: “Good DT Chicago Base For Our Family; Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Karras
Reviews.Content: Our family decided to try this Residence Inn as our base for doing the standard Chicago museum-viewing tourist stay, and we're glad we did. Among similar properties, this gave us the best package deal for what we wanted-- AAA rates plus parking provided a king suite, breakfasts, a pool, and an exercise room. Staff from valet parking in through valet parking out, and everywhere in between, were exceptionally courteous and did their jobs well. The entire hotel was clean and maintained well. The amenities of the Residence Inn chain were all there-- the kitchenettes, the multiple options for breakfast, the weeknight evening foods.... During our stay, we didn't find the place overly crowded, and thus our breakfast and pool experiences weren't lessened by mobs. One of the two common-area computers was available the two nights I wanted to check transit routes. Some notes: swimming pool is small (but open by 6:30 a.m.), You're a short walk from a drug store / grocery store, Starbucks (though house coffee is tolerable), and multiple dining options and major transit hubs are a short walk away (and you can catch a bus route right outside the hotel). Be forewarned a fire station is 1.5 blocks away (but even closer to other hotels), so you're likely to get at least a siren during the night. Remember you're in a big US city and prices/facilities reflect it; just plan for it, and bring tip money for the staff willing to serve you. We'd likely return to this place for similar-style Chicago vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Everytime Im in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DeeWoodz
Reviews.Content: I have gone to Chicago many times. The trip before this one, I stayed at the Hyatt on Wacker and as far as comparisons goes, this hotel is just as good if not better. It is located a short walk from the Mag. Mile and the Chicago nightlife/resturants (Harry Carey's and Ruth's Chris are right across the street). The hotel staff was very friendly and the rooms are great (I had the King Studio Suite). The best part was that I had a nice kitchen for when I was entertaining *guests*. If you are looking for exceptional service with a good price, this is the place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Room”
Reviews.Author: kayoung1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King Studio Suite which had the bed, couch, chair, flat screen TV, and kitchenette. It was a very nice room and the location of the hotel is within waliking distance of Michigan Ave, many restaurants, and nightlife. They serve a hot breakfast in the morning, but was very crowded both mornings. Parking was outrageous at $45/night, so we parked in a garage a block away for $24 a night. Would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and a great deal”
Reviews.Author: RLT2385
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. Breakfast, evening snack, great rooms, great service...I can't remember a nicer staff. The front desk staff, the food service staff, and the baggage handlers were all so helpful... Always went out of their way to make our experience enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: sungoddess3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn on Dearborn Street on March 15-17. I do not have a bad word to say about this place. Everything was excellent! Restuarants, bars, and sights are within walking distance to the hotel. I reserved a king room for us (me & my 2 kids) and there was plenty of room for us to manuever around in. We were given a room on the 21st floor and it had a nice view. The full size frig, microwave, cook top, and dishwasher were a great asset; even though we only used the frig. during our stay. The evening reception was a added bonus! We used the hot tub which was very hot (nice after a day of sightseeing). We did not use the pool...there were too many small (and very loud) children in the pool during our stay. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel without hesitation. I hope to return in the near future, that is, if my budget allows it; it was a 10 hour drive for us.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay Ruined”
Reviews.Author: LeonMart
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Residence Inn Chicago Downton/River North during our first trip to Chicago to celebrate my wife's birthday. We received a great rate through Travel Zoo of $90.00 per night for a Studio room. The rooms were very nice, comfortable, well appointed and roomy enough for 3 people. The hot breakfast was excellent and I cannot say enough nice things about the breakfast room staff.. For the most part, all the staff was very friendly and accomodating. We checked out of the hotel at noon on Sunday as our flight wasnt scheduled to leave O'Hare until 5 p.m. It was raining heavily outside and was in the upper 30's at the time. We stored our luggage and went to have lunch. During lunch I was contacted by the airline and found out that our flight was cancelled and the next flight out would be on Monday morning. I returned to the hotel at 1 p.m to get a room for Sunday night. I explained to the desk clerk that our flight was canceled due to bad weather. Even though we paid $90.00 per night for the previous three nights, I was offered a rate that was double that amount. I asked if we could get the same rate or at least something close to that considering the circumstances and he suggested I use the lobby computer to see if Travel Zoo was offering a reduced rate. I was unable to get any reduction on the rate through the computer. I contempleted going to another hotel but it was cold storming outside. I understand how rack rates work, but I think under these circumstances the hotel staff could have been more understanding and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Navigate440
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights in this hotel with my sisters. We went for an Oprah taping, which was a 10 minute taxi ride from the hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location, with lots of restaurants in walking distance (Harry Caray's Steakhouse is across the street). The room was very clean and comfortable. Stainless appliances in the well-stocked kitchen. Breakfast was included and was one of the best ones I've had - waffles (which Isme, the friendly server made for us), eggs, sausage, potatoes alond with muffins, cereal, fruit and yogurt. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jengaworld
Reviews.Content: The room was very pretty -- and the full kitchen is a real bonus. Terrific location, and the free internet is such a convenience. We liked it so much that we wanted to book an additional night, but the front desk clerk couldn't figure out how to do it. That was certainly odd (how hard is it to book a room?), but we took it as a sign we should give up on our impulsive desire to extend the trip so we just headed home. Happy stay overall. We will com back for the right rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moonette
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a writers' conference, and I picked this hotel because we like Residence Inn and got a great AAA rate through the Marriott website. The hotel is located on Dearborn and was about 16 or so blocks from the convention hotel. Even though Chicago was COLD, we walked to the conference every day and didn't mind at all (not that that has anything to do with the hotel itself). However, because we walked to the conference, we were able to see the restaurants and attractions that are all close to the Residence Inn, which made it great. The hotel staff was wonderful in recommending good places to dine (Sullivan's offers a prix fixe for RI guests.) and things to see. The room that we had was a king, and it was very roomy. It was decorated very beautifully, although I question having white covers on the beds. The pillow cases and the quilt, while clean, were a bit dingy, which is what happens when you have everything white. My few complaints were that the towels were not the best I've seen (pretty old feeling and looking) and that we did not receive shampoo every day, which I couldn't figure out. We're looking to go back, again, and will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Strange encounter in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Kowallske
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago for a convention and stayed at the Residence Inn for a week. We were four people and booked a 2-bedroom suite with a rather large living area and 2 bathrooms. One bedroom featured a kingsize, the other a queensize bed. The sofabed in the living area was around kingsize. The hotel is quite new, however the interior appears cheap and the bedrooms relatively small. The wardrobes are way too small for four people. We stayed on the 23rd floor and had quite an impressive view. We had an accessible room, the bell was for the hearing impaired, so that it was connected to a flashlight and made noises similar to a fire alarm, which was quite disturbing... After a friendly welcome we however made a strange first encounter in the bathrooms. Apparently the housekeeping staff forgot to clean the toilets before we arrived, or how could someone explain the excrements in the toilet (see picture)? Furthermore we found severe urine stains under the toilet seats, which was quite unappetizing, too. It took the management about half an hour to come to our room. The lady was quite uncomfortable with the situation and promised us a gift basket. The housekeeping cleaned both toiles and the gift basket appeared about two hours later. However the gift basket consisted of a 4 chocolate bars, 2 cheap bottles of wine and some nacho chips, which was not really satisfying. We did not encounter further problems during the rest of our stay. Staff was friendly, wireless internet worked well. Breakfast was redundant and the evening meal edible. The whirlpool had a nice 270Â° city view, but was apparently so full with chlorine, that all of us had a rash after using it. Irrespective of the excrements in the toilet I would stay at different place the next time, as the stay was quite expensive (730$/room/night) and the hotel appeared more like a good hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: umichmom66
Reviews.Content: This new Residence Inn was a great find in downtown Chicago! It is located on Dearborn, which just a short walk to Michigan Avenue and a couple blocks from the red line train station. First of all the hotel is brand new so everything is clean and in great condition. It is not clear on the website, but this is actually one large highrise hotel containing both a Residence Inn and a Spring Hill Suites (less expensive). The lobbies are one floor above street level and when you come out of the elevator the Residence Inn is on the right and the Spring Hill Suites is on the left. Both have their own check in, eating areas, etc with a shared mini-mart in the middle. The decor is modern and inviting. The weekend rate is significantly less than the weekday rate since this is a business hotel and it includes a full hot breakfast buffet which is hard to find in downtown Chicago hotels. This was the nicest Residence Inn kitchen I have seen: stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, etc... Free wireless internet service is also included. The bed is comfortable and there were two large flatscreen TV's. The doormen and breakfast staff were especially friendly. Within a block or so was House of Blues, Hard Rock Cafe, and Ruth Chris Steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value at the Residence Inn Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend trip to Chicago where we stayed at the Residence Inn Marriott. This hotel was newly updated with everything you needed for a great cost. We saw a show at the House of Blue which was a walk-able distance from our hotel. There were ample amount of restaurants, bars, shops, etc from the hotel as well. This hotel is in the heart of the city and very close to the river. The famous Harry Carey's restaurant/bar is directly across the street, which we went to twice! There is an Einstein Brother's Bagel's next door as well, which was convenient for snacks/coffee. All the rooms were suite style with a modern kitchen, sofa and chair, flat screen TV, bed and bath. The kitchen was not fully equipped, but had everything that was needed for a week: glasses, plates, bowls, wine glasses, pitchers, can opener, tupperware, etc. The continental breakfast was open early and was great!! They had multiple varieties of warm drinks (which were good while being in Chicago in Nov!) such as coffee, tea, hot chocolate, etc. There was a waffle machine (popular for the kids!), muffins, bagels, cereal, eggs, bacon, etc. This was one of the top free continental breakfasts we've had. The staff was friendly and helpful. They helped us with directions, getting taxi's, restaurant/bar suggestions, etc. One of the best things they did for us is be honest on what was a walk-able distance for us from the hotel versus needing a taxi. For the value, this was a great hotel. We plan on coming back to Chicago and staying here a second time. I would recommend this to anyone with kids and dogs (they have a pet program)!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Thanksgiving week.”
Reviews.Author: kande1
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel only one block from the river. It is easy to walk everywhere downtown from here. As a family with dietary restrictions, it was very nice to have the kitchen and be able to avoid eating out. The breakfast here is huge, and it is included. The breakfast room is nicer than most restaurants. We didn't really need another meal after the breakfast here, maybe just a snack or a light dinner in the room in the evening. There is a manager's reception Sun-Thurs, so it is possible that you could just have an apple or something in the afternoon, and be able to avoid eating out completely! The rooms are beautiful here. Our room was on the 26th floor, and it had two big bedrooms and two full bathrooms. The pull out couch was very comfortable for our 13 year old son. Another child could have slept on the cushion that comes off of the pull out couch, because it is a solid cushion, about 5 feet long and 2.5 feet wide. The two bedroom sleeps six people. We loved being on the 26th floor, it was perfect!!! I wouldn't even look into another hotel for the next time! The rooms are available from $119 a night. Our room went for $360 a night. Be aware that this is a pet friendly hotel, but it is smoke-free. We only saw one dog there, and there was no dog smell at all. The ventilation system is really good. There was a slight sewer gas smell in our bathroom. It was coming from under the toilet. They sealed it with caulk while we were there. They said they would fix it from under the toilet after we left. This is a great hotel and I can't imagine any problem that couldn't be taken care of just by asking the friendly staff. This is a great place for families to stay while visiting Chicago. There were lots of kids staying there while we were there, but the rooms were perfectly quiet inside. GREAT hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Where Is The Oven???”
Reviews.Author: lhabitat
Reviews.Content: I just arrived a few hours ago, and I must agree that the staff is friendly but unbending to give a gold member an upgrade. I agree with the smallest suite review!!! I was directed to three other rooms before I found one where I could finally open the drawer in the bedroom without hitting the bed, but there was no bathtub, only a shower. I was also told I would get a view of the fireworks, however on check-in it appears that no one bedroom suites had that view --- or any river view. I bought a pizza to heat only to return and discover there was no oven even though a full kitchen is advertised. There is only a two burner top, a full size refrig and a dishwasher---I would rather have a mini-fridge or no dishwasher and an oven. A lot of people do not "nuke" food. The evening light meal was more than adequate, but staff ran out of pasta and salad and brownies at 7:15, did not make more due to time, but did offer more bread and beverages. This has never happened anywhere I stayed before---especially with the receptionist indicating I could wait until 7:30 to make a plate for my daughter---I went to Trader Joes's and bought some pasta to go with the sauce. Yes, it is complimentary, but very much expected ...there were several other disgruntled families and businessmen. I do not like the split lobby, but obviously the owners are trying to economize in every way they can and have rented out the ground floor. It is probably safer and the second floor dining area is quite pleasant witht he second floor view. Everything is a trade-off. I totally prefer the comfort and amenities of the Residence Inn on Walton (miracle mile), however, it is a bit overrun with the "American Girl" groupies on the weekends and too many unruly children. This is more in the working/business section. However, many convention busses do not stop here and the front desk personnel indicated a one block walk south to the Westin River North when I called. After I checked in, it appears a three block walk to the Hilton Garden Inn for Convention shuttle. On the positive side, it is new and very clean. The internet works very well. I have not experienced the slow elevator problem described in previous emails yet. The staff appears used to the small room comments and are trying to fend the issue as graciously as possible. The top floor pool looked very nice, as did the work out facility...much nicer than the Residence on Walton for work out and that place has no pool. I would suspect this is a foreign owned Marriott as it is not similar to standard for this country in terms of space, amenities, etc. I will check on it.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Residence Inn Rooms Ever”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Margo
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenaged son and I stayed there last weekend. We had a one bedroom suite and it was the smallest square footage ever! We had to rearrange the living room furniture to open the sofa bed. The bedroom had only enough room for the king bed and 2 nightstands and about a one foot area at the foot of the bed to walk through. The hotel is very new (less than a year old) and the furnishings, TVs, bathroom and kitchen area are nice. The two TVs were flat screen. They don't tell you the property is joined to a Marriott Springhill Suites and the hotels share a minature pool on the top floor (they also share an exercise room). It took them forever to clean the room on Saturday (they came about 4 p.m. after we had been gone all day). The breakfast was good. There is also no room at the front of the hotel where the valets are--you have to jockey for a spot on the street to load and unload.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: OverworkedCouple
Reviews.Content: Stop searching for over-priced hotels! We are a picky 35-something couple wanting to stay in an affordable, yet accessible to all the activiites in downtown Chicago. The Residence Inn is really easy to get to. Forget renting a car, hop on the CTA blue line from O'Hare and get off at Clark/Lake Street station. Then, you're literally a 7 minute walk to the hotel! The staff service is excellent. We checked in and received a spacious studio-king room on the 24th floor facing east. Super quiet hotel - I couldn't believe we were in a large urban city. Hotel offers great breakfast every morning. Not just pastries, but eggs, cereal, home cooked waffles, yogurt, fresh fruit, pancakes, sausages, home fries...etc!!! We booked our rate of $189/US per night Thurs-Sunday through AAA directly through the Marriott site. No issues whatsoever. I can't say enough about how great this hotel was and how super CLEAN!!! Stay here, and forget about wasting your hard earned money at those "other" hotels along Michigan Avenue which are noisey and extremely expensive. It was only a 10 minute walk to Michigan Mile, State Street and theatre district. Have fun! Room 2414 was great, and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: gatorengineer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few hotels downtown Chicago but this is definitely one of my most pleasant stays. The rooms are clean and new, but what really took me back was the friendliness of the staff. Every time you see a staff member, they ask you how your stay is going and how your room is and if they can do anything, even if they just run into you in the elevator! The hot breakfast was as good as any breakfast diner in Chicago and the hearth room is comfortable and inviting. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: kellie-jo
Reviews.Content: What a Great Hotel stayed Two night, Staff was great!!! 4th trip to chicago, Will stay again at the hotel.Shop around for great deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: KMTToronto
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Residence Inn River North in downtown Chicago with our 3 young children. It was a fanastic experience-my son said it was his favourite vacation ever. The hotel is brand new but the employees are definitely not rookies-everyone that we spoke to was polite, helpful and in a cheerful mood. The hotel was very clean. The included breakfast was abundant. The room was spacious and clean. Our children stayed in the living room on the pull-out couch and a cot without complaint. We used the exercise room and pool every day. The pool was a great afternoon activity before dinner when everyone was tired of walking around Chicago. The hotel's location is excellent. You can easily walk to the Magnificent Mile, the river, Millenium Park, the Sears tower and many other attractions. We parked our car and never used it the whole time we were there. There is a kitchen in each room but note that there is only a 2 burner cook top and not an oven. But there is a microwave. The grocery store-Jewel Osco, is within walking distance if you don't want to use the hotel's free grocery delivery service. All in all we had a great time and will definitely stay at the Residence Inn again in Chicago and other cities in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Early Check-Out, Beware”
Reviews.Author: intl_traveler_8
Reviews.Content: We originally booked 2 nights with the hotel. Closer to our stay date, we have decided to make our stay short. So we called the hotel to see if we needed to cancel our second night. We were informed that we did not need to cancel and just check out a day earlier would be okay. We enjoyed our one night stay and checked out he next day at 11 or so. Gave the card to the clerk and asked if everything is okay with our check out...he said "you're all set". To our dismay, the hotel charged us for both nights and proceed to send us an invoice indicating that we have checked out at 12:59 the second day. So beware and make sure that you get receipts.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: trcr7498
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Residence Inn was exceptional. Very pleasant and helpful. The lobby was large and clean. However we did request early check in and did not receive it. We arrived shortly after 2pm and our room was not ready. Regular check in is at 3pm. We also requested extra towels for the room, but there were not any extra in the room. We had a corner suite that was suppose to have floor to ceiling windows, but they weren't quite all the way up to the ceiling....AND - the windows had smudges on them from where the previous people in the room had put there hands and such on the glass...that was kind of gross. The sleeper sofa had a matress cover on it when we pulled it out that had hair on it. We had to make the bed for the sleeper sofa ourselves and that bedding was clean. The rest of the room was clean as well. Breakfast was very good. The traditional make your own waffles, cereal, dough nuts and also eggs and sausage. The only problem I had with the breakfast was on the day we were checking out. Breakfast was served starting at 6:30am but this day the food wasn't brought out until 7:00am. This was inconvenient since we had to leave the hotel by 7:15 to catch the Amtrak home. I would stay here again though. The beds were very comfortable and the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very cramped for four people”
Reviews.Author: lbes
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (15 and 20 yr old kids) stayed here for a long weekend. Loved the location, and of course the standard Residence Inn ammenities of free full breakfast, in-room kitchen. Location is good - about a ten minute walk to Mag Mile, 15 minute walk to Navy Pier. Jewel and Whole Foods and Trader Joes are a five minute walk away. Movie theaters, etc are also in short walking distance. Exercise facility has about 12 machines (treadmill, bikes, eliptical trainer) as well as weights. Pool is small - splashing size. Nice view of city from the facility. We reserved an "extended studio" - larger than a regular studio, and requested a fold up bed. When we arrived, we were told that the hotel cannot provide fold-ups due to fire codes. so we made up a bed for 15 yr old son on the floor (pushing the small kitchen table and two chairs to the corner) using the couch cushion and an extra set of sheets/blankets. Be aware that when the sofa bed is extended, it meets the foot of the regular bed, so we crawled over each other all night when we had to get up. And with my son on the floor as well, there was precious little room to spare !

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: grassrootlax
Reviews.Content: This place is great big rooms with a nice lobby. A good place if you are going to be working in your room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling on Business or pleasure. I was able to get anywhere by train so I did not have to cab it which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel stay in Chicago yet”
Reviews.Author: haasmail2006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a "working vacation" from July 19th through July 27th. We had a considerable amount of luggage since we were staying for nine days. The bellmen were courteous and efficient and helped us with our luggage both when we arrived and when we left. They were able to check us in immediately even though we arrived at 1:00 pm, two hours early. We had a corner room with floor to ceiling windows on the 27th floor (paid an extra $10 for that). Nice views to the west. The room wasn't large and it had an unusual configuration, kind of "U" shaped wrapping the kitchen, dining, and sleeping area around a central bathroom to allow views on both outside walls. This made it seem smaller than it was, but it was fine. It's close to a fire station. With two glass walls, even on the 27th floor we could hear sirens several times each day, but it wasn't a problem. Full kitchen. Nicer counter top than I have in my own home. The refrigerator is great for leftover deep dish pizza and snacks. Close to many good restaurants and trains. It's a new hotel so everything was immactulate. And the breakfast buffet was better than most I have had. But the dining area gets crowded and isn't quite large enough. I will be staying here again the next time I visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Chicago Downtown / River North
HotelInfo.Address: 410 N Dearborn St, Chicago, IL 60610
